question.query: what are the top trending assets on Solana

content.title: Solana Heatmap Trending Tokens
content.description: This image is a heatmap displaying trending tokens on the Solana blockchain. The tokens are represented by rectangular blocks, with their names and market capitalization (MC) displayed. The top tokens are #Probity (MC: $17.3M), #KINGSOL (MC: $204.4M), $? (MC: $185.6B), $GHTK (MC: $316.6K), and $DID (MC: $146.4K). Other tokens include $ (MC: $9.3M),  (MC: $305.6K), $BRRR (MC: $233.7K), #Ballsack (MC: $770.4K), SWAGER (MC: $489.7K), #USELESS (MC: $294.6M), $ICM (MC: $18.9M), $SAVICI (MC: $9.6M), #goldcoin (MC: $1.4M), and $Ban (MC: $70.0M). The image also shows the percentage change for each token, with $? showing a 1036.7% increase. The heatmap uses color to represent the performance of the tokens, with red indicating negative performance and green indicating positive performance. The percentages next to each token represent the change in value.

content.title: Top Major Assets on Solana
content.description: The image displays a table of top major assets on the Solana blockchain. The table includes the following columns: # (rank), Token, Price 7D, Trendline 7D, Change 7D, Market Cap, and Volume 7D. The assets listed are Solana (SOL), Bitcoin (CBBTC), Ethereum (WETH), Zcash (ZEC), Monad (MON), Hyperliquid (HYPE), NEAR (NEAR), and Binance Coin (BNB). For each asset, the table provides the current price, the 7-day trendline, the 7-day change percentage, the market capitalization, and the 7-day volume. The image also includes buttons for 1H, 24H, 7D, and 30D timeframes.

content.title: Solana x402 Spotlights: Top Gainers, Most Traded, and Trending Tokens
content.description: This infographic from Solana Daily highlights the top performers on the Solana blockchain over the last 24 hours. The image is divided into three sections: Top Gainers, Most Traded, and Trending. The Top Gainers section displays the tokens with the highest percentage increases, including X4PAY (+41.6%), ACE (+30%), AVO (+29.2%), DREAMS (+28%), and HYPER (+23.9%). The Most Traded section lists tokens with their trading volumes in USD, featuring ACE ($38.25M), DREAMS ($23.99M), SWTCH ($6.89M), PAYAI ($5.21M), and CODEC ($4.04M). The Trending section showcases the tokens currently gaining attention: ACE, PAYAI, X4PAY, SWTCH, and SFY. The Solana Daily logo and social media handles are present at the bottom.

content.title: Solana Trending List
content.description: This image is a screenshot of a Telegram post from @SOLTRENDING, displaying a list of trending topics on the Solana blockchain. The list ranks various projects and tokens by their popularity, with the top 15 entries shown. Each entry includes a rank, the project name, and a volume metric (e.g., 542.5k, 420.6m). The top three are predictionXBT, Pippin, and Act I: The AI Proph. The image also includes a call to action to use a "Safeguard buy bot" and is "Powered by @Safeguard". The post is marked as edited and the time is 02:03.

content.title: Top Trending Solana Tokens (24H)
content.description: The image is a chart displaying the top trending tokens on the Solana ecosystem over a 24-hour period. The chart is structured as a tree diagram, with the most trending token at the top and subsequent tokens branching downwards. The top token is $CPT, with a 42.13% increase. Below $CPT are two tokens: $goldcoin (20.78%) and $jellyjelly (9.14%). Further down, $SACHI (5.04%), $PALMO (4.37%), and $å“ˆåŸºç±³ (3.37%) are displayed. The chart includes the token symbols, their percentage gains, and associated icons. The image also includes a 'Share Trend' button and an 'Apply Trend' button, along with the website address www.bullishmarketcap.com.

content.title: Solana 24h trading volume snapshot
content.summary: 24h Solana trading snapshot (courtesy @Orb_Markets): Coinbase Wrapped CBBTC is the top major asset after SOL; OFFICIAL TRUMP leads memecoins with $28.6M volume; HumidiFi Token (WET) tops DeFi with $10.2M; SpaceX PreStocks are top equities with ~$4.1M. Image shows a trending table with prices, market caps and 24h volumes.

bullets: Source: Orb Markets snapshot of trending tokens on Solana in the last 24 hours.
Coinbase Wrapped CBBTC is the most traded major asset after SOL (~$47.05M volume).
OFFICIAL TRUMP ($TRUMP) leads memecoins with $28.6M 24h volume (price listed $5.13).
HumidiFi Token (WET) tops DeFi tokens with $10.2M volume; SpaceX PreStocks show ~$4.07M in equities volume.
Attached image is a table showing price, 24h change, market cap, volume and buy buttons for each token.

rawResponse.title: Top Solana Ecosystem Coins by Market Cap
rawResponse.text:
View all tokens and cryptocurrencies used within the Solana Ecosystem below.
Read More about Solana Ecosystem

Solana is a general purpose blockchain similar to Ethereum. The underlying architecture is different, such that developers have to write applications using Rust instead of Solidity or Vyper. However, this may soon change with the introduction of the Neon EVM solution on Solana. End user applications as of now include decentralized finance (DeFi), non-fungible tokens (NFT), marketplaces, games, and more. One of its biggest features is its scalability in which Solana is able to process over 700,000 transactions per second. Its high throughput capability appeals to high frequency traders, which is spearheaded by FTX and Alameda Research. The first use case for DeFi applications on Solana is Serum, built by the team behind FTX.Â Building in the Solana Ecosytem? Check out our [Solana Data API](https://www.coingecko.com/en/api/solana)

searchParams.query: what are the top trending assets on Solana

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: Every single search result is directly related to trending assets or tokens on the Solana blockchain. The results provide specific lists, rankings, and data visualizations that match the user's intent perfectly.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The search contents are highly detailed. The system successfully extracted specific token names, market caps, price changes, and trading volumes from image descriptions. The use of multiple sources (DEXs, wallets, and social media snapshots) provides a comprehensive view of the ecosystem.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: The vast majority of the content is relevant. However, because 'trending' is a highly time-sensitive metric, the inclusion of results from several months ago (e.g., September and October 2025) acts as noise or filler when compared to the very recent results from January 2026.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The results cover a wide range of asset types including major tokens (SOL, cbBTC), memecoins (TRUMP, Fartcoin), and DeFi assets. It provides a variety of metrics (volume, price change, rank) across multiple platforms like Phantom, DexScreener, and Orb Markets, though a live real-time aggregate list would be the only way to improve it.
key_strengths: Inclusion of extremely recent data (January 2026).
Diverse sourcing from DEX trackers, wallet interfaces, and social media snapshots.
Detailed extraction of numerical data (MC, volume, % change) from visual content.
key_weaknesses: Presence of outdated 'trending' data from late 2025 which is no longer applicable to current market trends.
A few entries (like the OKX result) may include cross-chain assets not exclusive to Solana.
evaluation.overall_assessment: The search results are excellent, providing both recent and historical snapshots of trending assets on Solana. The system did an exceptional job of interpreting visual data into descriptive text, allowing the user to see exactly which tokens were performing well at different intervals. The high relevance and quality of the extracted information make this a very useful set for any user interested in the Solana ecosystem.

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results successfully identify several platforms and specific categories that track trending Solana assets (NFTs, tokens, and memecoins). However, many results are generic category landing pages rather than real-time lists.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: Several results consist almost entirely of website navigation menus, cookie consent forms (Kraken), or empty table headers (Solscan, CoinScan) without the actual data. A few results (Hello Moon, Step Finance, OKX) provide high-quality specific mentions.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: There is a very high amount of 'noise' in the text snippets, including long lists of other blockchains (DefiLlama), site navigation links (Messari, CoinMarketCap), and author bios. Only a small fraction of the total tokens processed contains the actual names of trending assets.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: While the search results mention a few specific assets (PENGU, SKR, PUMP, Honeyland Generations Bees, Sad Bones) and trending platforms (Pump.fun), they fail to provide a cohesive, ranked 'Top 10' or 'Top 5' list that a user would expect for this query.
key_strengths: Identifies specific trending NFTs on Hello Moon (Genesis Collection, Sad Bones).
Provides context on recent high-volume events (Pump.fun weekly volume, SKR airdrop).
Links to major analytical platforms dedicated to the Solana ecosystem.
key_weaknesses: High volume of boilerplate text, navigation menus, and cookie notices.
Several snippets show table headers without any of the data rows (e.g., Solscan, NFTScan).
Some information is outdated (mentioning Serum/FTX in a context that suggests they are current leaders).
evaluation.overall_assessment: The search results provide a decent starting point for research but require the user to sift through significant technical and UI 'noise'. While specific assets like $SKR and $PENGU are mentioned, the system failed to extract the actual dynamic lists from the leaderboard pages it found, likely due to how those sites render data or how the snippets were captured. The results are moderately useful but lack a concise, direct answer.

content.title: Most-mentioned assets by VCs and angel investors on X
content.description: This image is a table presenting data on the most-mentioned assets by VCs and angel investors on X (formerly Twitter). The table includes the following columns: Project, Total Mentions, Mentions % Change, Unique Investors, and Investors % Change. The projects listed are Bitcoin (BTC), Solana (SOL), Ethereum (ETH), Hyperliquid (HYPE), Pump.Fun (PUMP), World Liberty Financial (WLFI), and Base Chain (BASE). The data shows the total mentions for each project, the percentage change in mentions, the number of unique investors, and the percentage change in investors. For example, Bitcoin has 4321 total mentions, a -6.04% change in mentions, 2074 unique investors, and a -15.03% change in investors. Solana has 3226 total mentions, a +37.69% change in mentions, 1680 unique investors, and a +26.70% change in investors. Ethereum has 2802 total mentions, a -49.27% change in mentions, 1736 unique investors, and a -42.99% change in investors. Hyperliquid has 1411 total mentions, a +116.00% change in mentions, 1072 unique investors, and a +90.41% change in investors. Pump.Fun has 519 total mentions, a +136.65% change in mentions, 424 unique investors, and a +95.39% change in investors. World Liberty Financial has 473 total mentions, a +272.38% change in mentions, 304 unique investors, and a +169.03% change in investors. Base Chain has 396 total mentions, a -2.18% change in mentions, 342 unique investors, and a -6.30% change in investors.

content.title: Twitter thread discussing Tether's potential asset sales
content.description: The image is a screenshot of a Twitter thread discussing the possibility of Tether selling its gold, Bitcoin, and non-treasury assets to become compliant. The first tweet, by @jason, suggests that this topic will be discussed in the next six months. The tweet also mentions that rate cuts will make the business less attractive, but going legit in 2026 is a better plan. A reply by @based16z bets $1 million on the odds that Tether won't sell all their gold and Bitcoin in the next 12 months. Another user, @btcgenesis, replies to @based16z and @Jason.

content.title: Twitter thread discussing crypto assets and buyback programs
content.description: The image is a screenshot of a Twitter thread. The first tweet, by Cole, states "The asset goes up the ticker goes down lol." The second tweet, by Max Alpha, says the asset is $ETH but the ticker is $BMNR and criticizes the selling of the asset below mNAV. The third tweet, by Nasdaq Tiger, says "Start the buyback programme." The fourth tweet, by gg_eth, criticizes the company for posting the same stuff every day and claims it's a scam. The fifth tweet, by Nasdaq Tiger, asks how they are going to get the 1.5 billion for the promised buyback programme. The tweets have various engagement metrics such as replies, retweets, and likes.

content.title: Clankers are first class assets on Farcaster
content.summary: Farcaster highlights that Clankers are first class assets. Clankers are tokens that automatically show the creator. Farcaster is working on an alternate way to verify ownership for tokens that are not Clankers. Clankers are first class assets.

bullets: Clankers are tokens that automatically show the creator of the token.
Farcaster is working on an alternate way to verify ownership for tokens that are not Clankers.

Clanker token pages on Farcaster include information such as quantity, USD value, creator, market cap, age, 24H volume, liquidity, fully diluted valuation, contract address, platform, chain, and website.

images.title: Farcaster Post Announcing Token Page Features and Clanker Creator Information
images.description: The image is a screenshot of a Farcaster post by the user "v" with a verified checkmark. The post discusses the creator information on token pages, specifically mentioning "Clanker." If a user launches a clanker, they are automatically shown as the creator of the token. For tokens that aren't clankers, the platform is working on an alternate way to verify ownership. The post includes a screenshot of a token page, displaying a chart of the token's price over time, along with details such as contract address, platform (Clanker), chain (Base), and website (bankr.bot). The screenshot also shows the fully diluted valuation ($63.4M) and the USD value ($105.73). The post is dated 8/19/25 and has 12 recasts, 4 quotes, 102 likes, and 1.3K views.

content.title: Loopscale adds SPYr, NVDAr, TSLAr
content.summary: Loopscale announces three Remora rStocks are now live on its credit markets: SPYr, NVDAr, and TSLAr. Users can "loop" these rStocks to create leveraged long positions or borrow USDC using rStocks as collateral. Tweet includes a marketing image listing the SPYr/USDC, NVDAr/USDC, and TSLAr/USDC leverage loops.

bullets: Now live: Remora rStocks SPYr, NVDAr, and TSLAr available on Loopscale.
Users can Loop (leverage) SPYr, NVDAr, or TSLAr to open leveraged long positions.
rStocks can be posted as collateral to borrow USDC via Loopscale credit markets.
Marketing image lists SPYr/USDC, NVDAr/USDC, TSLAr/USDC labeled as "Leverage Loop".

content.title: X Smart Cashtags Integration for Solana Tokens
content.description: A screenshot of a tweet from the official Solana account announcing that X (formerly Twitter) is launching 'Smart Cashtags'. The image features two mobile UI mockups demonstrating the feature. The first mockup shows a user drafting a tweet and typing '$B', which triggers a dropdown menu of financial assets. The menu includes Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.B stock), Bitcoin (BTC token), BONK (Solana token), and BASE (Ethereum token). BONK is specifically highlighted, showing its market cap of $925M and a price change of -4.29%. The second mockup displays a detailed view of a 'Smart Cashtag' for Nvidia (NVDA), featuring a real-time price of $136.68, a line chart of price action, and prominent 'Sell' and 'Buy' buttons. This integration allows users to access financial data, charts, and news directly within the X timeline, facilitating a more seamless trading and social experience.

content.title: Twitter Trending Topics: Bitcoin, Arrest, Polymarket, and Theoliquid
content.description: The image is a screenshot of Twitter's trending topics. The top trend is "#Bitcoin" with 92.4K posts, categorized under "Business & finance". The second trend is "Arrest" with 134K posts, categorized under "Politics". The third trend is "Polymarket" with 59.5K posts, and the fourth is "Theoliquid". The image also includes a "Show more" button at the bottom.

![](https://ethereum.org/_next/image/?url=%2Fimages%2Fman-and-dog-playing.png&w=1920&q=75)
# Real-world assets (RWAs)
* A method for turning valuable commodities into digital tokens.
* You can now own portions of real-life objects or assets, rather than having to buy an entire property or item.
* Connects traditional finance with the blockchain ecosystem.
Real-world assets (RWAs) are tokens representing existing forms of wealth, such as real estate, gold, stocks, art, machinery or collectibles. Tokenizing these items translates them into digital form, allowing them to be divided between multiple owners and making it easier to trade them.
## [](#what-are-rwas)What are RWAs?
Some RWAs are tangibleâ€”items you can see and touch, such as gold bars or commercial buildings. Others are intangible, such as government debt, intellectual property, or equity in a company.
When tokenized, these assets are turned into units of value. Tokenized gold is a good example of how this works. The company[Paxosopens in a new tab](https://www.paxos.com/)translates 400-ounce gold bars into 400 tokens on the Ethereum blockchain, each backed by one ounce of gold. Token-holders can redeem their tokens for gold at any point. Thatâ€™s also the case for tokens purchased from another RWA company,[Tether Goldopens in a new tab](https://gold.tether.to/).
Each token can be divided into even smaller fractions. Tether Gold tokens, for instance, can be split into parts as small as 0.000001.
RWA tokens donâ€™t have any intrinsic value. Rather, they reflect the value of the item that the

rawResponse.title: Twitter Files: What they are and why they matter
rawResponse.author: Aimee  Picchi
rawResponse.text:
[Watch CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/live/)

The so-called Twitter Files are the brainchild of Twitter owner Elon Musk, who has said he wants to show "what really happened" behind the scenes regarding content moderation decisions at the social media company before he bought it in October.

The Twitter Files have been released in dribs and drabs throughout December, with three journalists â€” Matt Taibbi, Bari Weiss and Michael Shellenberger â€” delving into the internal documents and discussions to highlight the company's decision-making process around some high-profile actions, such as banning former President Donald Trump in January 2020.

Under Musk, who has said he wants Twitter to be a mecca for free speech, the company hasÂ [reinstated some previously banned accounts](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/twitter-accounts-reinstated-elon-musk-donald-trump-kanye-ye-jordan-peterson-kathy-griffin-andrew-tate/), such as those belonging to Trump and far-right Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene. (Ye, the rapper formerly known as Kanye West, was [reinstated](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kanye-west-twitter-account-returns-elon-musk/) but thenÂ [banned again](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kanye-west-suspended-from-twitter-again-elon-musk/)Â less than two weeks later.) Musk has been critical of the prior management's content moderation decisions, arguing that they engaged in censorship.

Here's what to know about the Twitter Files and what they reveal.

## What are the Twitter Files?

The Twitter Files consist of thousands of internal documents, including many Slack discussions, between Twitter employees about their content moderation decisions.

So far, there have been five releases from the Twitter Files, each focusing on a different facet of Twitter's content moderation.

- [Twitter Files Part 1](https://twitter.com/mtaibbi/status/1598822959866683394?t=2c6hbUzovHaWgkadt-vTEA&s=19) focuses on the company's decisions surrounding news about material found on what is alleged to be Hunter Bi

searchParams.query: what assets are being discussed on twitter

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results directly and precisely address the query. Every result provides specific assets (BTC, SOL, ETH, NVDA, etc.) that are currently or recently being discussed on X (Twitter) and Farcaster, including rankings and specific social media threads.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The content is of high quality, featuring detailed descriptions of images that transcribe data tables (e.g., total mentions, percentage changes) and summaries of complex Twitter threads. The use of 'Smart Cashtags' and trending topics screenshots adds significant value.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: While most information is highly relevant, there is notable redundancy. The Messari report on 'Most-mentioned assets' is presented three times (as image 245237, post 112405, and image 239791), which slightly reduces the overall token efficiency.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The results provide a very complete picture of the 'Twitter' asset landscape, covering institutional/VC interests (Messari data), retail/meme trends (Pump.fun, BONK), real-world assets (Ondo, Mavryk), and traditional finance integration (Nvidia and S&P500 rStocks).
key_strengths: Specific quantitative metrics (e.g., mention counts and % growth).
Diverse range of assets including crypto, stocks, and tokenized real-world assets.
Excellent image-to-text descriptions that preserve data table integrity.
key_weaknesses: Redundancy in the form of multiple entries for the same Messari data table.
A few results are from Farcaster, which while similar to Twitter, technically falls slightly outside a strict interpretation of the query.
evaluation.overall_assessment: This search result set is exceptional. It provides exactly what a user would want when asking about trending assets on social media: lists of the most-mentioned projects, growth statistics, and specific narrative-driven discussions (like the Tether thread). The data is current and spans various market niches.

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search system struggled with the intent of the query. The user is likely looking for 'social listening' dataâ€”specific financial assets (stocks, crypto, RWAs) currently trending or frequently mentioned on Twitter. The results instead provided generic definitions of 'assets' from government/financial sites or general Twitter usage statistics.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The individual sources are authoritative (Federal Reserve, White House, Investopedia, Wikipedia), but they are misaligned with the specific user intent. The text is clear and accurate for what it is, but it is not what was requested.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: Almost none of the content identifies specific assets being discussed on Twitter. Result 13 briefly mentions 'Twitter's most important assets' (user base, etc.), interpreting 'assets' as corporate holdings rather than topics of discussion. The rest of the content is filler regarding digital asset policy or general social media marketing stats.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The results fail to name a single trending asset or provide a summary of current Twitter discourse regarding investments. It provides background on what assets are, but not what is being discussed on the platform.
key_strengths: High-authority sources (Fed, White House, FINRA).
Provides a corporate perspective on what Twitter's internal assets are (Result 13).
key_weaknesses: Misinterprets 'assets being discussed' as a request for the definition of assets or policy papers.
Lacks real-time or social media sentiment data.
High redundancy among 'asset valuation' and 'digital asset' definitions that don't reference Twitter.
Fails to provide a list of specific tickers, coins, or commodities trending on the platform.
evaluation.overall_assessment: The search results are a failure of intent recognition. The system treated the query as a request for academic or regulatory definitions of assets rather than a request for current social media trends. To answer this query effectively, the search should have targeted social listening tools, market sentiment reports, or news articles about 'FinTwit' trends. The current results are high-quality documents in isolation but irrelevant to the specific user question.

# Real-world assets (RWAs)
* A method for turning valuable commodities into digital tokens.
* You can now own portions of real-life objects or assets, rather than having to buy an entire property or item.
* Connects traditional finance with the blockchain ecosystem.
Real-world assets (RWAs) are tokens representing existing forms of wealth, such as real estate, gold, stocks, art, machinery or collectibles. Tokenizing these items translates them into digital form, allowing them to be divided between multiple owners and making it easier to trade them.
## [](#what-are-rwas)What are RWAs?
Some RWAs are tangibleâ€”items you can see and touch, such as gold bars or commercial buildings. Others are intangible, such as government debt, intellectual property, or equity in a company.
When tokenized, these assets are turned into units of value. Tokenized gold is a good example of how this works. The company[Paxosopens in a new tab](https://www.paxos.com/)translates 400-ounce gold bars into 400 tokens on the Ethereum blockchain, each backed by one ounce of gold. Token-holders can redeem their tokens for gold at any point. Thatâ€™s also the case for tokens purchased from another RWA company,[Tether Goldopens in a new tab](https://gold.tether.to/).
Each token can be divided into even smaller fractions. Tether Gold tokens, for instance, can be split into parts as small as 0.000001.
RWA tokens donâ€™t have any intrinsic value. Rather, they reflect the value of the item that the"

    "title": "Twitter Files: What they are and why they matter",
    "url": "https://www.cbsnews.com/news/twitter-files-matt-taibbi-bari-weiss-michael-shellenberger-elon-musk/",
    "publishedDate": "2022-12-14T00:00:00.000Z",
    "author": "Aimee  Picchi",
    "text": "[Watch CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/live/)

The so-called Twitter Files are the brainchild of Twitter owner Elon Musk, who has said he wants to show "what really happened" behind the scenes regarding content moderation decisions at the social media company before he bought it in October.

The Twitter Files have been released in dribs and drabs throughout December, with three journalists â€” Matt Taibbi, Bari Weiss and Michael Shellenberger â€” delving into the internal documents and discussions to highlight the company's decision-making process around some high-profile actions, such as banning former President Donald Trump in January 2020.

Under Musk, who has said he wants Twitter to be a mecca for free speech, the company hasÂ [reinstated some previously banned accounts](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/twitter-accounts-reinstated-elon-musk-donald-trump-kanye-ye-jordan-peterson-kathy-griffin-andrew-tate/), such as those belonging to Trump and far-right Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene. (Ye, the rapper formerly known as Kanye West, was [reinstated](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kanye-west-twitter-account-returns-elon-musk/) but thenÂ [banned again](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kanye-west-suspended-from-twitter-again-elon-musk/)Â less than two weeks later.) Musk has been critical of the prior management's content moderation decisions, arguing that they engaged in censorship.

Here's what to know about the Twitter Files and what they reveal.

## What are the Twitter Files?

The Twitter Files consist of thousands of internal documents, including many Slack discussions, between Twitter employees about their content moderation decisions.

So far, there have been five releases from the Twitter Files, each focusing on a different facet of Twitter's content moderation.

- [Twitter Files Part 1](https://twitter.com/mtaibbi/status/1598822959866683394?t=2c6hbUzovHaWgkadt-vTEA&s=19) focuses on the company's decisions surrounding news about material found on what is alleged to be Hunter Bi"
  }
]

content.title: Crypto Venture Weekly: Dec 8â€“12, 2025
content.summary: 22 projects raised $176M this week; LI.FI and Real Finance led with $29M each. Strategy and Apimeds added ~$1.063B in Bitcoin treasuries. Major M&A: Stripe acqui-hired Valora team, Jupiter acquired Rain.fi, Nexo acquired Buenbit, ProCap BTC completed SPAC to become ProCap Financial. Notable raises: Surf $15M, Cascade $15M, Crown $13.5M, TestMachine $6.5M, Magma Finance $6M, AllScale $5M, Pye Finance $5M, Goblin Finance $1M. Nyx Group launched a $100M liquid-focused fund. Twitter commentary emphasized Ethereum settlement moats, stablecoins as fintech rails, token-unlock market structure, and defenses of permissionless finance.

bullets: 22 projects raised a combined $176 million during Dec 8â€“12, 2025.
Top two rounds: LI.FI and Real Finance, $29M each.
Other notable rounds: Surf $15M, Cascade $15M, Crown $13.5M, TestMachine $6.5M.
Strategy (Nasdaq: MSTR) purchased ~10,624 BTC (~$963M), raising holdings to ~660,600 BTC.
Apimeds Pharmaceuticals closed a $100M PIPE and moved ~1,000 BTC into a segregated treasury.
Combined treasury allocations in the report total roughly $1.1B in BTC deployments.
Stripe acqui-hired the Valora team; Valora app/tech returned to cLabs for stewardship.
Jupiter acquired Rain.fi to expand credit and structured lending on Solana; community snapshot taken Dec 10.
Nexo acquired Buenbit to accelerate LATAM expansion; deal subject to regulatory approvals.
Nyx Group launched a $100M multi-strategy liquid markets vehicle targeting hands-on founder support.
ProCap BTC completed a SPAC merger with Columbus Circle Capital; rebranded as ProCap Financial (Nasdaq: BRR).
Other M&A: Inveniam acquired Swarm Markets; Lead acquired Loop Crypto.
Ryan Watkins: Ethereumâ€™s neutral, global settlement layer has widening, hard-to-replicate network effects.
Spencer Applebaum: Stablecoins are foundational rails enabling specialized fintech builders.
Dougie DeLuca: Token unlock schedules are reshaping liquid market structure and investor behavior.

# Mira Murati's AI startup Thinking Machines valued at $12 billion in early-stage funding
ByReuters
July 15, 20255:26 PM UTCUpdated July 15, 2025
Text

July 15 (Reuters) - Thinking Machines Lab, the artificial intelligence startup founded by former OpenAI executive Mira Murati, said on Tuesday it has raised about $2 billion at a valuation of $12 billion in a funding round led by venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz.
The fundraise also saw participation from AI chip giant Nvidia[(NVDA.O), opens new tab](https://www.reuters.com/markets/companies/NVDA.O), Accel, ServiceNow[(NOW.N), opens new tab](https://www.reuters.com/markets/companies/NOW.N), Cisco[(CSCO.O), opens new tab](https://www.reuters.com/markets/companies/CSCO.O), AMD[(AMD.O), opens new tab](https://www.reuters.com/markets/companies/AMD.O)and Jane Street, the startup said.

# Thinking Machines Lab Raises a Record $2 Billion, Announces Cofounders
Mira Murati and several other former OpenAI researchers are behind the buzzy AI startup, now valued at $12 billion and officially out of stealth.
![Mira Murati chief technology officer of OpenAI Inc. during an interview on The Circuit with Emily Chang in San Francisco...](https://media.wired.com/photos/6876aa0f40ee0d77bac5b85b/master/w_2560%2Cc_limit/Mira-Murati-Cofounders-Business-1258711450.jpg)
Mira Murati during an interview on*The Circuit With Emily Chang*in San Francisco.Photograph: Philip Pacheco/Getty Images
Save StorySave this story
Save StorySave this story
Thinking Machines Lab,an[artificial intelligence](https://www.wired.com/tag/artificial-intelligence/)company founded by top researchers who fled OpenAI, has raised a record $2 billion seed round that values the fledgling firm at $12 billion.
The funding round was led by Andreessen Horowitz and included Nvidia, Accel, Cisco, and AMDâ€”among others. The mammoth investment reflects the ultracompetitive race to build advanced AI systems, as well as the premium placed on top AI talent. It is the largest seed funding round in history.
Thinking Machines is led by CEO Mira Murati, who[stepped down as OpenAIâ€™s chief technology officer last September](https://www.wired.com/story/openai-cto-mira-murati-is-leaving-the-company/). Her cofounders are John Schulman, a computer scientist who helped build ChatGPT; Barrett Zoph, ex-vice president of research at OpenAI; Lilian Weng, who worked on AI safety and robotics at the company; Andrew Tulloch, who worked on pretraining and reasoning; and Luke Metz, who worked on post-training at OpenAI. * *$11B acquisition to deliver end-to-end data platform for businesses to connect, process and govern data for applications and AI agents*
* *Transaction expected to be accretive to adjusted EBITDA within the first full year, and free cash flow in year two, post close*
ARMONK, N.Y. and MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.,Dec. 8, 2025/PRNewswire/ -- IBM (NYSE:[](#financial-modal)[IBM](http://www.ibm.com/investor)) and Confluent, Inc. (NASDAQ:[CFLT](#financial-modal)), the data streaming pioneer, today announced they have entered into a definitive agreement under which IBM will acquire all of the issued and outstanding common shares of Confluent for $31 per share, representing an enterprise value of $11 billion. Confluent provides a leading open-source enterprise data streaming platform that connects, processes and governs reusable and reliable data and events in real time, foundational for the deployment of AI.
IDC estimates that more than one billion new logical applications will emerge by 20281, reshaping technology architectures across industries. To fuel meaningful outcomes and drive productivity in operations, these applications, as well as AI agents, need access to connected and trusted data â€“in real time. IBM and Conflu

searchParams.query: what projects have recently raised funding

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results directly address the query by providing multiple detailed reports and snapshots of cryptocurrency projects that have raised funding. The data covers various dates, with the most recent appearing to be January 2026, which aligns well with the request for 'recent' projects.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The information is sourced primarily from Messari, a reputable crypto intelligence platform. The results are highly structured, including summaries, key points, project IDs, and even investor names, making the data very actionable and clear.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: While the content is highly relevant, there is significant redundancy. Several results (e.g., post_id 340588, 340534, and image_id 447269) cover the exact same fundraising week of January 5â€“9, 2026. Additionally, there are a few older entries from 2024 that are less relevant to a 'recent' query.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The results provide a comprehensive list of projects across different sectors (DeFi, Infrastructure, AI, etc.), including specific amounts raised, lead investors, and even company valuations (e.g., Rain's $1.95B valuation). It offers a breadth of information that fully satisfies the user's intent.
key_strengths: High-quality structured data with specific project names and dollar amounts.
Includes lead investor information and funding rounds (Seed, Series A, Series C).
Provides a multi-week view of the market, offering a broader perspective on 'recent' activity.
key_weaknesses: High level of duplication across posts, tweets, and images for the same events.
Contains some outdated results from 2024 which are no longer 'recent'.
Some results focus on M&A or Treasury moves rather than pure project fundraising.
evaluation.overall_assessment: The search results are excellent for identifying recently funded projects in the crypto space. They provide detailed, high-integrity data from professional sources. Although there is some repetition and a few stale results, the density of high-quality, relevant information is very high, allowing for a comprehensive overview of recent venture capital activity in this sector.

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results directly address the query by providing several specific examples of companies and projects that have recently raised funding, including names, amounts, and sectors.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The results are from reputable sources like Reuters, TechCrunch, and CNBC. However, several results are cluttered with navigation menus and boiler-plate website text rather than the full article content.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: There is significant redundancy and noise. For example, there are four separate results regarding Mira Murati's 'Thinking Machines' funding and two for 'Cursor.' Additionally, large blocks of the text in the TechCrunch and CNBC results are just site navigation links.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The results cover a wide range of funding events across different industries (AI, Carbon Markets, Crypto) and include various stages (Seed, Late-stage). It also includes directories for further exploration.
key_strengths: Identifies high-profile and specific funding rounds with clear dollar amounts (e.g., $2B for Thinking Machines, $2.3B for Cursor).
Covers diverse sectors including AI, Environmental/Carbon projects, and Web3.
Provides direct links to major news outlets for verification.
key_weaknesses: High level of redundancy with multiple links covering the same news story.
Presence of irrelevant content like the IBM acquisition of Confluent, which is an exit/acquisition, not a funding round.
Significant 'token waste' from large chunks of navigation menus in the web snippets.
evaluation.overall_assessment: The search results successfully provide a list of recently funded projects as requested. While there is a high degree of repetition and some clutter from website navigation, the core informationâ€”company names, funding amounts, and lead investorsâ€”is clearly present. The results appear to be from a dataset with future-dated or hypothetical metadata (2025/2026), but within that context, they are highly relevant.

# Mira Murati's AI startup Thinking Machines valued at $12 billion in early-stage funding
ByReuters
July 15, 20255:26 PM UTCUpdated July 15, 2025
Text
* Small Text

Share

July 15 (Reuters) - Thinking Machines Lab, the artificial intelligence startup founded by former OpenAI executive Mira Murati, said on Tuesday it has raised about $2 billion at a valuation of $12 billion in a funding round led by venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz.
The fundraise also saw participation from AI chip giant Nvidia[(NVDA.O), opens new tab](https://www.reuters.com/markets/companies/NVDA.O), Accel, ServiceNow[(NOW.N), opens new tab](https://www.reuters.com/markets/companies/NOW.N), Cisco[(CSCO.O), opens new tab](https://www.reuters.com/markets/companies/CSCO.O), AMD[(AMD.O), opens new tab](https://www.reuters.com/markets/companies/AMD.O)and Jane Street, the startup said.
Sign up[here.](undefined?location=article-paragraph&redirectUrl=/technology/mira-muratis-ai-startup-thinking-machines-raises-2-billion-a16z-led-round-2025-07-15/)
The massive funding round for a company launched only in February, with no revenue or products yet, underscores Murati's ability to attract investors in a sector where top executives have become coveted targets in an escalating talent war.

# Thinking Machines Lab Raises a Record $2 Billion, Announces Cofounders
Mira Murati and several other former OpenAI researchers are behind the buzzy AI startup, now valued at $12 billion and officially out of stealth.
![Mira Murati chief technology officer of OpenAI Inc. during an interview on The Circuit with Emily Chang in San Francisco...](https://media.wired.com/photos/6876aa0f40ee0d77bac5b85b/master/w_2560%2Cc_limit/Mira-Murati-Cofounders-Business-1258711450.jpg)
Mira Murati during an interview on*The Circuit With Emily Chang*in San Francisco.Photograph: Philip Pacheco/Getty Images
Save StorySave this story
Save StorySave this story
Thinking Machines Lab,an[artificial intelligence](https://www.wired.com/tag/artificial-intelligence/)company founded by top researchers who fled OpenAI, has raised a record $2 billion seed round that values the fledgling firm at $12 billion.
The funding round was led by Andreessen Horowitz and included Nvidia, Accel, Cisco, and AMDâ€”among others. The mammoth investment reflects the ultracompetitive race to build advanced AI systems, as well as the premium placed on top AI talent. It is the largest seed funding round in history.
Thinking Machines is led by CEO Mira Murati, who[stepped down as OpenAIâ€™s chief technology officer last September](https://www.wired.com/story/openai-cto-mira-murati-is-leaving-the-company/). Her cofounders are John Schulman, a computer scientist who helped build ChatGPT; Barrett Zoph, ex-vice president of research at OpenAI; Lilian Weng, who worked on AI safety and robotics at the company; Andrew Tulloch, who worked on pretraining and reasoning; and Luke Metz, who worked on post-training at OpenAI. Yield Bearing Assets & Stablecoins Report 2025 RedStone blog

# Yield Bearing Assets & Stablecoins Report 2025
November 12, 2025
#### Table of Contents
![](https://blog.redstone.finance/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/YSB_Stablecoins-Report-2025.png)# Key Takeaways
* Traditional finance has spent a century building yield infrastructure. Crypto hasn’t caught up just yet. Yield-generating assets make up just**8-11%**of crypto markets versus**55-65%**of TradFi. That’s a**5-6x**development gap, but yield bearing assets are positioned for significant growth as the “Crypto-as-Infrastructure” thesis gains traction.
* The GENIUS Act is being called the most significant catalyst for crypto since the Bitcoin whitepaper. The timing couldn’t be better. As clarity emerges, yield bearing stablecoins are exploding: market capitalization is up**300% YoY**, with new protocols launching monthly to capture the opportunity.
* Blue-chip yield products are gaining major momentum. ETH liquid staking tokens (LSTs) surged from 6 million to 16 million between 2023 and November 2025, adding**$34 billion**in notional value at current prices. SOL LSTs doubled over the same period, adding**$10 billion**in market cap. Meanwhile, Bitcoin yield products are emerging as the next frontier.
* **Yield bearing Real-World Assets (RWAs**) are bridging TradFi and onchain finance. Traditional institutions recognize the efficiency gains and are accelerating tokenization efforts. Beyond stablecoins, Private Credit and US Treasuries are leading the charge, capturing the largest capital inflows across all tokenized asset categories.
* **DeFi runs on yield bearing assets (YBAs)**. ETH and SOL LSTs alone account for ro

rawResponse.title: Digital Assets Market Update | Fall 2025
rawResponse.author: Houlihan Lokey
rawResponse.text:
Fall 2025 FinTech Group:
Digital Assets Market Update
1
Digital Assets Market Update
Fall 2025
Stablecoins Have Emerged as the Killer App of Digital Asset Infrastructure
Stablecoins are evolving into foundational infrastructure for cross-border payments, FX, and programmable treasury operations. 
The GENIUS Act in the U.S. and MiCA in the EU are unlocking broader use by providing regulatory certainty, driving enterprise
interest from FinTechs, asset managers, and global banks.
The Digital Asset Ecosystem Is Scaling Through Institutional Rails
The digital assets ecosystem is entering a new phase of institutionalization, with traditional financial institutions increasingly 
partnering with or acquiring crypto-native platforms to offer hybrid products. Growth in custody, compliance tooling, and real-time 
settlement layers is enabling scalable, regulated adoption across capital markets, data services, and payments.
Wallets Are Emerging as the New Distribution Layer for Tokenized Assets
Growing adoption of wallets over traditional financial accounts is paving the way for broader access to tokenized assets. From real 
estate and trade finance to private market funds, tokenization is streamlining issuance, settlement, and secondary market activityâ€”
with wallets becoming the new distribution layer.
Infrastructure, Tokenization, and Compliance Are Driving Record Fundraising and M&A Activity
Fundraising and M&A activity hit record highs in Q2 2025, driven by demand for infrastructure, tokenization, and AI-integrated 
blockchain services. Investors are backing compliance-forward platforms, while strategic buyers target scalable solutions in custody, 
payments, and data. Momentum is expected to continue into 2H.
Digital Asset Equities Are Outperforming as Investor Confidence Rebounds and Digital Asset Prices Surge(1)
Houlihan Lokeyâ€™s Digital Assets Public Index has outperformed the S&P 500 year-to-date by +9%, reflecting renewed investor 
confidence in well-capitalized, regula

# Digital assets: The next frontier for markets and investors
**Since 2008, digital assets have captured investor interest and grown at an astounding pace. And with recent advancements in AI and other disruptive technologies, the digital asset industry continues to propel financial innovation forward. Keep reading to discover the emerging opportunities and strategies unfolding.**

To simplify the digital asset marketplace and its investment possibilities, weâ€™ve compiled this concise explainer that covers what digital assets are, how theyâ€™ve evolved, whatâ€™s propelling the market, how to gain exposure, and why you might choose to use them in a portfolio.

**Despite challenging overall market**conditions in 2023, continuing investments in frontier technologies promise substantial future growth in enterprise adoption. Generative AI (gen AI) has been a standout trend since 2022, with the extraordinary uptick in interest and investment in this technology unlocking innovative possibilities across interconnected trends such as robotics and immersive reality. While the macroeconomic environment with elevated interest rates has affected equity capital investment and hiring, underlying indicatorsâ€”including optimism, innovation, and longer-term talent needsâ€”reflect a positive long-term trajectory in the 15 technology trends we analyzed.

searchParams.query: what are the current trends being discussed and what assets are fueling them

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results interpret 'trends' and 'assets' almost exclusively through a financial and cryptocurrency lens (Stablecoins, Real World Assets, Tokenization). While this directly addresses the keywords in the query, it ignores broader global, societal, or non-financial technology trends, which might be what a general user is looking for.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The results include high-authority sources such as the IMF, McKinsey, IOSCO, and Houlihan Lokey. However, several results are thin, consisting only of landing pages, disclaimers (American Century), or error messages (Coinbase).
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: A significant portion of the provided text is 'noise,' including navigation menus, subscription prompts, cookie consents, and social media links. Result 14 is entirely an error message, and Result 6 is a legal disclaimer. However, Results 3, 8, and 9 contain high-value, dense summaries.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: For the specific niche of digital assets and fintech, the results are quite complete, covering stablecoins, LSTs (Liquid Staking Tokens), and RWAs (Real World Assets). It fails to provide a comprehensive answer for 'trends' in a general sense (e.g., climate, geopolitics, or non-AI software).
key_strengths: Inclusion of highly authoritative institutional reports (IMF, IOSCO)
Specific identification of the 'assets' fueling trends, such as yield-bearing assets and AI training data
Current and forward-looking data reaching into 2025 and 2026
key_weaknesses: Severe topical bias towards the cryptocurrency/blockchain sector
High volume of irrelevant boilerplate text and UI elements
Several results are dead ends or landing pages with no actual content
evaluation.overall_assessment: The search results are highly effective if the user's intent was to learn about the current state of digital finance and asset tokenization. The quality of the institutional sources provides credibility and depth. However, the search results are cluttered with navigational junk, and the lack of topical diversity makes the answer incomplete for a general query about global trends.

question.query: what new DeFi protocols are gaining attention

content.title: Ignas DeFi Tweet: DeFi Innovation, AI Platforms, New Protocols, and TGEs
content.description:
The image is a tweet by Ignas | DeFi (@DefiIgnas) discussing upcoming developments in the crypto space. The tweet mentions the shift from macro discussions to internal crypto innovation. It highlights several key areas:

*   **AI DeFi Platforms:** Launching of AI DeFi platforms, with examples like swapping ETH to $HYPE via @Cortex_Protocol and earning points on @AIWayfinder.
*   **0-to-1 Innovative Protocols:** Traction of innovative protocols, including @ethos_network for reputation, @timedotfun for pricing, @noise_xyz for trading mindshare, and @3dns_inc for tokenizing web2 domains.
*   **Privacy on Ethereum:** Live implementation of privacy features with @0xbowio.
*   **New Hot Protocols Going Mainnet:** The launch of new protocols on mainnet, including Monad, MegaETH, Succinct, and Farcaster's Snapchain.
*   **New Airdrop Farms:** New airdrop farms, such as @FogoChain points and the HyperEVM ecosystem.
*   **Upcoming Token Generation Events (TGEs):** Upcoming TGEs for projects like $INIT, $ES (Eclipse), Hyperlane, $RESOLV, and $KERNEL.

The tweet provides a snapshot of emerging trends and projects within the DeFi and broader crypto ecosystem.

content.title: The Daily Degen - February 4th, 2025
content.summary: Vertex Protocol, the official sponsor, is seeing surging trading volumes, $12.5M in annualized fee revenue, and massive APRs for LPs and VRTX stakers. New deployments on Sonic, Botanix, and Abstract, and a coming deployment to Berachain via BroTrade dex. Crypto market mixed, with Hyperliquid and Core down over 25% weekly, and Lido and JustLend down over 15%. New projects like Herd, Summerstone, and Exponent Finance gaining attention.

content.title: The Daily Degen- October 15th, 2024
content.summary: Highlights a new DeFi protocol called MortgageFi that allows users to take out mortgages against crypto assets like BTC and ETH at fixed interest rates without KYC or credit checks. Also covers top crypto market movers, TVL trends, and other crypto news and analysis.

content.title: DeFi Market Update & New Project Overview
content.summary: Daily Degen covers market updates, TVL movers, and new projects. Upshift, a yield protocol, is spotlighted. Radix & Cronos zkEVM are green chains. New projects: @vibe_trading, @AtlantisOnSonic. pumpdotfun's new Raydium is a success.

bullets: Upshift is a yield protocol on steroids for the institutional age of defi.
It has already attracted over $200M in TVL.
Radix and Cronos zkEVM are the only top 100 chains green on all three timelines (daily, weekly, monthly).
Kodiak, Tether Gold, Ethereal, Paxos Gold, Defi Saver, and Superstate are the only top 100 protocols green on all three timelines (daily, weekly, monthly).
New projects mentioned include @vibe_trading, @AtlantisOnSonic, @UFBots, and @dopplerprotocol.
@vibe_trading is an instant perps trading platform.
@AtlantisOnSonic is the first Launchpad&Dex built on @SonicLabs.
@UFBots is a Fight Club for Robots.
@dopplerprotocol is a custom capital markets platform.

images.title: Top 5 DEXs by Volume
images.description: The image is a screenshot of a tweet by NPC68, highlighting the top 5 DEXs by volume. The tweet states that Pump Fun is now among the top 5 DEXs by volume and has handled more than 3x as much volume as $RAY in the last 24 hours. A table is presented showing the rankings, names, chains, weekly change, and 24h volume of the top DEXs. PancakeSwap leads with $1.827b volume, followed by Uniswap with $1.356b, and Pump with $921.59m. Other DEXs listed are Fluid, Orca, Curve Finance, Meteora, and Raydium.

images.title: DeFi Liquidity Provider Fees vs. Token Incentives
images.description: The image is a chart from Token Terminal illustrating the cumulative fees earned by liquidity providers (LPs) versus token incentives. The chart's x-axis represents time, spanning from January 2018 to January 2025. The y-axis represents supply-side fees and token incentives, with values ranging from $0 to $15 billion. The chart shows two lines: a green line representing "Supply-side fees" and a blue line representing "Token incentives." The green line surpasses the blue line in February 2025, indicating that LPs are earning more from protocol fees than from token incentives. In March 2025, supply-side fees are at $13.990 billion, and token incentives are at $13.529 billion. The chart's title is "Cumulative fees earned by liquidity providers surpassed token rewards in Feb 2025."

content.title: The Daily Degen - January 31st, 2025
content.summary: Crypto's first consolidated asset platform, Gasp, is launching an omnichain-rollup model to eliminate high gas costs and fragmentation in DeFi trading. The detailed thread and whitepaper provide insights into Gasp's innovative technology. The Daily Degen is helping raise awareness about Gasp's upcoming releases.

content.title: The Daily Degen- December 21st, 2024
content.summary: Vertex Protocol is expanding its omnichain liquidity infrastructure, deploying on new chains, offering lucrative rewards and APRs for users. The protocol is also hosting competitions for traders. Key highlights include upgrades for deeper omnichain liquidity, new deployments, and massive APRs for LPs and VRTX stakers.

content.title: Top 15 Protocols to Watch in 2026
content.summary: Pink Brains lists 15 projects to watch in 2026 across prediction markets, high-throughput L2s, RWA infrastructure, privacy, stablecoins, consumer apps, and AI agents. Highlights include Polymarketâ€™s institutional volume and US re-entry; MegaETHâ€™s sub-10ms claims and Ethena-backed stablecoin; Cantonâ€™s RWA throughput; Aztecâ€™s privacy L2; Tempo (payments L1) and Base as consumer distribution layers. The thread flags likely token events, mainnet launches, and growing institutional adoption in 2026.

bullets: Polymarket: claims $50B+ annualized volume, institutional entry, ICE investment, US re-entry, possible token and L2 in 2026.
MegaETH & Sonic: high-throughput L2sâ€”sub-10ms latency, 100k TPS claims, native stablecoin (Ethena/MegaUSD) and staking/TGE plans.
RWA & TradFi rails: Canton and Ostium highlighted for tokenized RWAs, large throughput and institutional integrations.
Privacy, payments, consumer apps: Aztec (privacy L2), Payy (ZK-powered card), Tempo (payments L1), and Base (Coinbase app) primed for adoption.
AI & new UX: Virtuals and OpenMind focus on tokenized AI agents and embodied robotics; Euphoria and Flying Tulip target mobile-native trading UX.

content.title: Early-Stage Protocols â€” Jan 2026 Alpha List
content.summary: Curated thread listing 10 under-the-radar protocols with one-line descriptions, token status, and airdrop potential. Covers derivatives (exotic & equity perpetuals), CLOB DEX, coordination/prediction markets, prime brokerage, stablecoin infrastructure, cross-chain listings, and yield/fixed-income tokenization. Useful discovery list for early allocators and airdrop hunters.

bullets: Author shares 10 early-stage protocols; each item includes category, one-liner, token status, and airdrop potential.
Focus areas: derivatives (exotic & equity perpetuals), CLOB DEX, prediction/coordination markets, prime brokering, stablecoins.
Several entries highlight high airdrop potential or live tokens (e.g., $TROVE pending, $HST live, $U live).
Useful for early discovery and candidate list for further on-chain/activity due diligence.

images.title: Nado Protocol Dashboard Overview
images.description: A comprehensive dashboard for the Nado protocol, a CLOB DEX offering Spot, Perpetuals, and Money Markets with unified margin. The protocol is developed by the team behind Kraken and is deployed on the Ink blockchain. The dashboard displays a Moni Score of 1759, categorized as Level 3 (Developing), and a Momentum Score of 1107%, ranking it in the top 7 of 5683 tracked projects. A follower growth chart shows a significant surge from late September to December 2025, reaching 8.28K followers. A recent event log from December 23, 2025, notes the addition of new perpetual trading pairs for XMR, XAUT, SUI, TAO, PUMP, and AAVE with up to 10x leverage.

images.title: TROVE Protocol Dashboard and Social Metrics Overview
images.description: A comprehensive dashboard for the TROVE protocol, a platform for trading collectibles, Real World Assets (RWAs), and equities with up to 10x leverage. The dashboard displays project info, social scores, and growth metrics. TROVE is built on the Abstract Chain and is currently in public beta. Key data points include a Moni Score of 3377 (Level 4, Established) with a 3-month growth of +3347, and a Momentum Score of 2079%, ranking it in the top 3 of 5683 projects. A follower growth chart shows a rise from near zero in late September 2025 to 10.36K followers by December 26, 2025, representing a gain of 10,242 followers. The 'Tweets & events' section highlights recent mentions from influencers like Otto Suwen and Cold Blooded Shiller on December 25, 2025.

content.title: The Daily Degen - January 7th, 2025
content.summary: The Daily Degen newsletter covers the latest crypto market updates, including the launch of Vertex Protocol on the Sonic chain, which offers a suite of products like onchain spot, perpetuals, and money markets. It also highlights the top TVL movers, new projects, stablecoin yields, and important news and analysis from crypto influencers.

content.title: The Daily Degen - January 16th, 2025
content.summary: Highlights key market updates, including Timeswap's upcoming community round, top TVL movers, stablecoin yields, and notable crypto news/analysis from industry leaders.

content.title: The Daily Degen - February 9th, 2025
content.summary: Crypto market cap at $3.289T. Bullish news for Vertex Protocol, who plans to expand to 25+ chains by end of 2025. Top TVL gainers include Base, Sonic, Kava, and Hyperliquid. Potential Pump.fun token launch generating buzz. Inflation data due this week. Crypto watchlist and analysis from industry experts.

content.title: The Daily Degen - January 12th, 2025
content.summary: Vertex Protocol is partnering with Brotrade DEX to provide perps trading infrastructure on the Berachain network. This will enable traders to access over 60 perps and spot markets on Berachain, with Vertex's omnichain liquidity. The partnership aims to revolutionize trading on the Berachain ecosystem.

content.title: DeFi Systems Launching Soon
content.summary: mattytay lists DeFi systems launching soon: Rakurai, N0DTE, wattprotocol, pyefinance, seedplex_io, darklakefi, vanishTrade, Tempo_Trade, OREsupply, omnipair, heavendex, and met_engine.

bullets: Rakurai_io: Custom txn scheduling for higher APY staking.
N0DTE: Zero-day options trading.
wattprotocol: Staking for long-tail tokens.
darklakefi: MEV-resistant and private darkpool trading.
vanishTrade: Compliant, private trading.
Tempo_Trade: Trading bot deployment+management platform.
pyefinance: Time-locked staking derivatives.
seedplex_io: Equity fundraising onchain.
omnipair: permissionless lending.

content.title: Crypto Twitter Mindshare Leaderboard
content.summary: Edgen highlights USDai, Reservoir, Rice AI, and Sui as projects gaining traction on Crypto Twitter. USDai offers a yield-bearing dollar for AI infra. Reservoir is developing a stablecoin on Berachain. Rice AI targets the robotics market. Sui is a well-capitalized layer-1.

bullets: USDai offers a yield-bearing dollar for AI infrastructure.
Users can mint USDai and stake it for sUSDai.
Both are backed by real-world hardware like GPUs and servers.
Reservoir is developing a stablecoin on Berachain.
It powers rUSD, srUSD, and trUSD.
It is backed by on-chain and real-world assets.
Rice AI is a DePin play targeting the robotics market.
Robots collect and sell training data for $RICE rewards.
It is backed by FLOKI, DWF Labs, and TokenFi.

images.title: Crypto Twitter Mindshare Leaderboard - August 20, 2025
images.description: The image is a "Mindshares of the week" graphic from edgen+ Rader, dated August 20, 2025. It features logos of five projects: Arc (Circle), USD.ai, Reservoir, RICE AI, and Sui. The graphic suggests these projects are gaining traction. USD.ai is highlighted as offering a yield-bearing dollar for AI infrastructure. Reservoir is developing a stablecoin on Berachain. RICE AI targets the robotics market, and Sui is described as a well-capitalized layer-1 blockchain.

content.title: DeFi Developments Summary
content.description: The image is a tweet from The DeFi Investor summarizing recent developments in the DeFi space. Key highlights include BlackRock's BUIDL fund expanding to Solana, Chainlink partnering with Abu Dhabi Global Market for tokenization frameworks, Sonic announcing a high-yield algorithmic stablecoin with up to 23% APR, Beraborrow launching its POLLEN token and its public sale on Fjord Foundry, Ethereum's final testnet for the Pectra Upgrade, dYdX launching a token buyback program with 25% of protocol fees allocated to monthly buybacks, and Hyperliquid launching spot trading for ETH, with the exchange suffering an attack due to market manipulation.

rawResponse.author: Uniswap Labs
rawResponse.text:
Continuous Clearing Auctions: Bootstrapping Liquidity on Uniswap v4
[All Stories](https://blog.uniswap.org/)[#Protocols](https://blog.uniswap.org/category/protocols)
November 13, 2025
# Continuous Clearing Auctions: Bootstrapping Liquidity on Uniswap v4
#Protocols
![](https://images.ctfassets.net/oc3ca6rftwdu/1PoaTpW4VVhSuyvuHZ00NA/ec701d0eaf5738376bf709e607771b2a/CCA-Blog-Post-3__2_.png?w=1200&h=900&q=100&fit=crop)
Today weâ€™re excited to announce Continuous Clearing Auctions (CCA), a permissionless protocol that helps teams bootstrap liquidity on Uniswap v4 and find the market price for new and low-liquidity tokens.
This is the first of several tools weâ€™re building to help projects launch and deepen liquidity on the Uniswap protocol.
Built in collaboration with Aztec, the first project to launch with CCA, the protocol also includes an optional ZK Passport module that enables private, verifiable participation.
## [](https://blog.uniswap.org/continuous-clearing-auctions#what-cca-solves)What CCA solves
Liquidity formation often happens behind closed doors. That creates information gaps, privileges a few players, and can leave markets thin and unstable. We think there is a better way. CCA was designed around three core principles:
* **Onchain-native market creation.**The entire auction runs onchain, with pricing, bidding, and settlement happening transparently. No gatekeepers or offchain deals.
* **Fair, gradual price discovery.**Supply is distributed over time through a continuous clearing process. This incentivizes bidding early, reduces sniping, limits volatility, and helps the market converge toward a fair value.
* **Automatic liquidity seeding on Uniswap v4.**When the auction ends, proceeds automatically create a Uniswap v4 pool at the discovered price, deepening liquidity.## [](https://blog.uniswap.org/continuous-clearing-auctions#how-it-works)How it works
**Setting up the auction**

# Top 7 Decentralized Finance Trends for Investors in 2025

August 25, 2025

Blog

Decentralized finance, or DeFi, has rapidly transformed the financial landscape, offering innovative solutions that challenge traditional banking systems. As we move through 2025, several key trends are emerging that investors should monitor closely. These trends not only reflect the maturation of the DeFi ecosystem but also indicate the growing acceptance and integration of blockchain technologies into everyday financial activities. Understanding these trends can equip investors with the insights needed to navigate the evolving market effectively.

In this article, we will highlight seven critical trends in decentralized finance that are shaping the future of investment. Each trend provides a unique perspective on how DeFi is evolving, presenting both opportunities and challenges for investors. By staying informed about these developments, investors can position themselves strategically in this dynamic sector.

## 1\. Growth of DeFi Wallets

DeFi wallets have become essential tools for anyone participating in the decentralized finance ecosystem. Unlike traditional wallets, DeFi wallets provide users with complete control over their assets and private keys, which is a fundamental principle of decentralization. As more users seek secure and user-friendly ways to manage their cryptocurrencies and DeFi assets, the demand for robust DeFi wallets is surging.

Investors should pay attention to the features offered by various DeFi wallets. Many of these wallets now include functionalities such as built-in trading capabilities, staking options, and integration with multiple DeFi protocols. ## Is Cardano DeFi? Exploring the Cardinal Protocol Revolution

Cardano has taken a bold step into the decentralized finance (DeFi) space with the launch of the Cardinal Protocol, a groundbreaking innovation that bridges Bitcoin liquidity into Cardanoâ€™s ecosystem. This development not only positions Cardano as a key player in the DeFi sector but also introduces Bitcoin holders to a trust-minimized, decentralized way to engage with DeFi services.

### What Makes Cardano DeFi?

Cardanoâ€™s DeFi ecosystem has been steadily growing, but the introduction of the Cardinal Protocol marks a significant milestone. Unlike traditional DeFi platforms that rely on centralized custodians or federated systems, Cardinal leverages advanced cryptographic methods to ensure decentralization and security. This makes Cardanoâ€™s DeFi ecosystem unique and attractive to Bitcoin holders seeking decentralized solutions.

### The Cardinal Protocol: Bridging Bitcoin to Cardano

The Cardinal Protocol enables Bitcoinâ€™s unspent transaction outputs (UTXOs) to be wrapped into transferable tokens on the Cardano blockchain. These wrapped tokens maintain a strict one-to-one peg with their original Bitcoin counterpart, ensuring that users can redeem their Bitcoin at any time. This process is facilitated by MuSig2, a multi-signature cryptographic protocol that enhances security and decentralization.

## Introduction to Haedal Protocol and Its Impact on Sui Blockchain

Haedal Protocol is making waves in the cryptocurrency world by offering a unique liquid staking solution on the Sui blockchain. Launched on Binance Alpha in April 2025, Haedal Protocol allows users to stake their SUI tokens while maintaining liquidity through yield-bearing haSUI tokens. This innovative approach not only enhances capital efficiency but also integrates deeply with the Sui DeFi ecosystem, providing users with multiple avenues to maximize their returns.

## How Haedal Protocol Works: Liquid Staking Explained

At the core of Haedal Protocol is its liquid staking mechanism. Users can stake their SUI tokens and receive haSUI tokens in return. These haSUI tokens represent the staked assets and accumulate yield over time. The value of haSUI is determined by the formula:

**haSUI Price = Total Staked SUI / Total haSUI in Circulation**

This ensures that as more SUI is staked, the value of haSUI increases, providing long-term holders with potential value appreciation. Moreover, haSUI tokens can be used across various DeFi applications within the Sui ecosystem, allowing users to earn additional rewards.

## Key Features of Haedal Protocol

### Liquid Staking with haSUI

Haedal Protocol's liquid staking model allows users to keep their assets productive even while staked. By receiving haSUI tokens, users can continue participating in DeFi activities, such as providing liquidity on Cetus DEX or engaging in lending and borrowing on platforms like Scallop.

### Governance and Utility of $HAEDAL

## Why Morpho Stands Out in the DeFi Ecosystem

### $10 Billion Deposit Milestone and TVL Growth

Morpho's rapid growth in deposits and TVL underscores its increasing adoption and trust within the DeFi community. Surpassing $10 billion in deposits is a clear indicator of the protocol's ability to attract liquidity and deliver value to its users. This achievement positions Morpho as a leading player in the DeFi lending market, driving innovation and broader adoption.

### Multi-Chain Strategy for Seamless Liquidity

Morpho's multi-chain strategy enables interoperability across major blockchain networks, including Ethereum, Arbitrum, Polygon, and Base. This approach ensures seamless capital flow, avoiding the bottlenecks often associated with single-chain platforms. By enhancing liquidity management and scalability, Morpho provides a versatile solution for users across diverse blockchain ecosystems.

### Singleton Contract Architecture: Lower Gas Costs

A standout feature of Morpho is its singleton contract architecture, which simplifies smart contract management and significantly reduces gas costs. This design makes the protocol more accessible, particularly for users concerned about high transaction fees. Compared to competitors like Aave, Morpho offers a streamlined and cost-effective alternative, enhancing its appeal to a broader audience.

searchParams.query: what new DeFi protocols are gaining attention

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results directly and explicitly answer the query. Every result provided contains lists, descriptions, or summaries of emerging DeFi protocols that are currently gaining attention or are expected to launch soon.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The contents are highly descriptive, providing not just project names but also their unique value propositions (e.g., 'zero-day options', 'AI-driven DeFi', 'tokenized web2 domains'). The data is well-structured into key points and project lists.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: The density is high, though there is significant redundancy with certain protocols (e.g., Vertex Protocol and Sonic) appearing in multiple newsletter snippets. Some results also include general market data (market cap, inflation) which is slightly off-topic but common for newsletter summaries.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The search results provide a very broad overview of the DeFi landscape, covering multiple sectors including RWA, AI-DeFi, Perps, Privacy, and Yield protocols. It covers both current live projects and those in the 'alpha' or pre-launch phase.
key_strengths: High volume of specific, named protocols across various niches.
Includes social mindshare data and 'top watch' lists from reputable influencers.
Categorizes protocols by function (e.g., AI platforms, 0-to-1 innovation, Privacy).
Provides context on what makes each protocol unique rather than just listing names.
key_weaknesses: Significant repetition of certain 'sponsored' or popular protocols like Vertex across several search results.
Temporal confusion: the dates range from late 2024 to early 2026, which may make it difficult for a user to distinguish what is 'new' right now versus what was new six months ago.
evaluation.overall_assessment: This is an excellent search result set for anyone looking to discover new DeFi projects. It provides a massive variety of 'alpha' (early information) and covers the ecosystem from multiple angles (technical innovation, social media traction, and institutional adoption). While there is some repetition of major projects, the diversity of the secondary lists more than compensates for it.

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results directly address the query by identifying several specific DeFi protocols (Rho, Mangrove, Haedal, Newton, Cardinal) and broader trends/lists for 2025-2026. The search successfully moved beyond well-known giants like Aave or Uniswap to find emerging projects.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: While the sources include reputable platforms like the Uniswap Blog and OKX Learn, many snippets are heavily cluttered with navigation menus, author bios, and SEO boilerplate. Several results appear to be future-dated SEO 'listicles' (e.g., 'Top 10 in 2026') which can be less reliable than technical documentation.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: A significant portion of the text across results 1, 3, 4, 5, and 15 is 'noise'â€”consisting of website UI text, 'Buy Crypto' buttons, and social media links. Only about half of the total tokens provide specific details about the protocols themselves.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The results provide a good variety of protocols across different blockchains (Sui, Cardano, Ethereum/L2s, Bitcoin-bridge) and use cases (Liquid Staking, AI-Automation, Institutional Rates, DEXs). It provides enough names and high-level descriptions for a user to begin a deep dive.
key_strengths: Identifies specific, lesser-known protocols like Haedal and Newton.
Includes a variety of DeFi niches such as AI-driven finance and institutional derivatives.
Provides results from diverse chains including Sui and Cardano rather than just Ethereum.
key_weaknesses: High level of 'token waste' due to website headers and navigation links in the snippets.
Several results are speculative/SEO-focused lists with '2026' dates which may lack immediate technical substance.
Fragmented information; the user has to piece together names from multiple shallow snippets.
evaluation.overall_assessment: The search was highly successful at finding names of 'new' or 'attention-gaining' protocols, which is the hardest part of the query. While the information density is low due to poor snippet extraction (too much UI text), the diversity of protocols foundâ€”ranging from Uniswap v4's new auction tools to AI-automation layersâ€”makes this a high-quality set of results for a researcher.

# Continuous Clearing Auctions: Bootstrapping Liquidity on Uniswap v4
#Protocols
![](https://images.ctfassets.net/oc3ca6rftwdu/1PoaTpW4VVhSuyvuHZ00NA/ec701d0eaf5738376bf709e607771b2a/CCA-Blog-Post-3__2_.png?w=1200&h=900&q=100&fit=crop)
Today weâ€™re excited to announce Continuous Clearing Auctions (CCA), a permissionless protocol that helps teams bootstrap liquidity on Uniswap v4 and find the market price for new and low-liquidity tokens.
This is the first of several tools weâ€™re building to help projects launch and deepen liquidity on the Uniswap protocol.
Built in collaboration with Aztec, the first project to launch with CCA, the protocol also includes an optional ZK Passport module that enables private, verifiable participation.
## [](https://blog.uniswap.org/continuous-clearing-auctions#what-cca-solves)What CCA solves
Liquidity formation often happens behind closed doors. That creates information gaps, privileges a few players, and can leave markets thin and unstable. We think there is a better way. CCA was designed around three core principles:
* **Onchain-native market creation.**The entire auction runs onchain, with pricing, bidding, and settlement happening transparently. No gatekeepers or offchain deals.
* **Fair, gradual price discovery.**Supply is distributed over time through a continuous clearing process. This incentivizes bidding early, reduces sniping, limits volatility, and helps the market converge toward a fair value.
* **Automatic liquidity seeding on Uniswap v4.**When the auction ends, proceeds automatically create a Uniswap v4 pool at the discovered price, deepening liquidity.## [](https://blog.uniswap.org/continuous-clearing-auctions#how-it-works)How it works
**Setting up the auction**

# Top 7 Decentralized Finance Trends for Investors in 2025

August 25, 2025

Blog

Decentralized finance, or DeFi, has rapidly transformed the financial landscape, offering innovative solutions that challenge traditional banking systems. As we move through 2025, several key trends are emerging that investors should monitor closely. These trends not only reflect the maturation of the DeFi ecosystem but also indicate the growing acceptance and integration of blockchain technologies into everyday financial activities. Understanding these trends can equip investors with the insights needed to navigate the evolving market effectively.
