WunderTrading

MAKE YOUR CRYPTO WORK

![](https://wundertrading.com/journal/upload/media/default/0001/02/thumb_1549_default_big.jpeg)

The word of mouth is a power that you should never underestimate. It is capable of causing massive price spikes or drowning a promising DeFi project despite its utility and the passion of its development team. We will discuss top crypto narratives in 2025Â and think about the potential impact of these stories on the cryptocurrency market.

Letâ€™s start with a simple question:Â [what are crypto narratives](https://wundertrading.com/journal/en/learn/article/what-are-narratives-in-crypto)? How can a simple story move gigantic market caps and decisively affect market sentiment?

## What are narratives in crypto?

Imagine yourself as a confused little boy preparing to go into a fight with a bully. You are afraid, you donâ€™t believe in yourselfâ€¦ You want to run. Then, an older brother says that the guy in front of you is not that strong and you can easily win. Others start encouraging you saying that courage beats strength and the victory is one hit away.

Well, this story has two possible scenarios:

1. A little boy believes in himself, rushes into the fight, and wins thanks to the encouragement of others. The story ends well and the impact of the rapidly forming narrative makes it possible for you to find the necessary resources to win.
2. A little boy believes in himself, rushes into the fight, and receives a beating like never before in his life. This ending is the result of a story full of lies that inspired someone to act on false promises and unfounded hype.

The same is true for top narratives in crypto. A story can stand on a solid fo

rawResponse.author: Raphael Auer, Bernhard Haslhofer, Stefan Kitzler, Pietro Saggese and Friedhelm Victor
rawResponse.text:
BIS Working Papers 
No 1066 
The Technology of 
Decentralized Finance 
(DeFi) 
by Raphael Auer, Bernhard Haslhofer, Stefan Kitzler, 
Pietro Saggese and Friedhelm Victor 
Monetary and Economic Department 
January 2023 
 
 JEL classification: E42, E58, F31, G19, G23, L50, O33, G12. 
Keywords: financial engineering, decentralized finance, 
DeFi, blockchain, Ethereum, DLT, cryptocurrencies, 
stablecoins, cryptoassets. 
BIS Working Papers are written by members of the Monetary and Economic 
Department of the Bank for International Settlements, and from time to time by other 
economists, and are published by the Bank. The papers are on subjects of topical

This publication is available on the BIS website (www.bis.org).

reproduced or translated provided the source is stated. 
ISSN 1020-0959 (print) 
ISSN 1682-7678 (online) 
The Technology of Decentralized Finance (DeFi)
Raphael Auerâˆ— Bernhard Haslhoferâ€  Stefan Kitzlerâ€¡ Pietro SaggeseÂ§
Friedhelm VictorÂ¶
January 17, 2023
Abstract
Decentralized Finance (DeFi) is a new financial paradigm that leverages distributed ledger
technologies to offer services such as lending, investing, or exchanging cryptoassets without
relying on a traditional centralized intermediary. A range of DeFi protocols implements
these services as a suite of smart contracts, ie software programs that encode the logic of
conventional financial operations. Instead of transacting with a counterparty, DeFi users
thus interact with software programs that pool the resources of other DeFi users to maintain
control over their funds. This paper provides a deep dive into the overall architecture, the
technical primitives, and the financial functionalities of DeFi protocols. We analyse and
explain the individual components and how they interact

searchParams.query: what new narratives are being discussed in DeFi

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results directly address 'narratives' within the DeFi and broader crypto space. Most results are from late 2025 and early 2026, providing a current view of 'new' topics. Only one result (from 2020) is irrelevant to the 'new' aspect of the query.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The contents are diverse, including professional research (CoinGecko), conference takeaways, and expert opinions. The summaries are well-structured with clear key points and project tags, making the information easy to digest.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: The majority of the content provides specific examples of narratives (e.g., RWAs, AI DeFi, anti-MEV, consumer-grade yield). While there is some overlap across sources, this consensus adds value. A few results (like the narrative scoring formula) are more meta than informative regarding specific narratives.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The results cover a wide spectrum of the DeFi landscape: institutional shifts (RWAs as collateral), consumer UX improvements (Aave Earn), technological shifts (Privacy, ZK rollups), and cross-sector integrations (AI, Robotics). It provides a comprehensive answer to what is being discussed.
key_strengths: Temporal relevance with several high-quality results from late 2025 and early 2026.
Identification of specific, actionable trends such as 'amplified yield', 'forex perps', and 'Robotics x Crypto'.
Good mix of technical narratives (modularity, privacy) and market-driven narratives (institutional TAM, memecoins).
key_weaknesses: Inclusion of an extremely outdated result from 2020 which is irrelevant to 'new' narratives.
Some '2024' content is mixed in which, while useful for context, may not be considered 'new' by the time of the 2026 results.
evaluation.overall_assessment: This search result provides a high-quality overview of the evolving DeFi narrative landscape. It successfully identifies a shift from speculative 'insider' DeFi to institutional and consumer-focused applications. The inclusion of recent conference takeaways and specific project examples (Aave, Monad, Infinifi) provides concrete evidence for the identified trends. Except for one legacy result, the information is timely and highly relevant.

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results directly address the query, with most titles and content focusing on crypto and DeFi 'narratives' specifically for the 2025-2026 period. The results pinpoint exactly what is being discussed in the industry.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The results include a mix of high-quality research (BIS, Galaxy, 1kx) and SEO-heavy blog posts. While some snippets are very informative (Result 2, 3, 7, 13), several others are cluttered with website navigation text or are cut off before providing the actual list of narratives (Result 1, 5, 6). One result is a broken ArXiv recaptcha page.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: While there is a high volume of relevant keywords, the density is lowered by significant amounts of boilerplate text, navigation menus, and repetitive social media headers. However, the 'Key Takeaways' and 'Bullet points' in results 2, 3, 7, and 14 are very efficient.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The combined results provide a very thorough list of current narratives, including RWA (Real World Assets), DePIN (Decentralized Physical Infrastructure), Liquid Restaking (LRTs), Bitcoin DeFi, AI-powered agents, and Tokenized Money Market Funds (TMMFs). It covers institutional, retail, and technical trends.
key_strengths: Identifies specific, high-growth categories like RWA, DePIN, and Restaking.
Includes authoritative perspectives from financial institutions (BIS) and reputable research firms (Galaxy, 1kx).
Provides forward-looking insights into 2025 and 2026 trends.
key_weaknesses: Several results are 'dead' or low-value due to poor snippet extraction (e.g., ArXiv recaptcha, Medium sign-in pages).
Some snippets cut off just as they are about to list the narratives (Results 4 and 6).
Occasional redundancy across multiple 'Top 10' style blog posts.
evaluation.overall_assessment: The search results successfully identify the major 'new narratives' in DeFi. A user looking for this information would be able to construct a comprehensive list of trends including RWA tokenization, Bitcoin-based DeFi, and AI integration. The quality of the sources is generally high, though the raw text extraction includes a lot of noise that requires filtering.

## What Are Crypto Narratives?

Narratives in cryptocurrency refer to the trending ideas, stories, or beliefs that shape how people perceive and value cryptocurrencies. These narratives can influence investor sentiment, market trends, and the adoption of new technologies.

* * *

### Key Takeaways

- Narratives in cryptocurrency refer to the trending ideas, stories, or beliefs that shape how people perceive and value cryptocurrencies â€“ they can influence investor sentiment, market trends, and the adoption of new technologies.

- Liquid restaking tokens, liquid staking derivatives, blockchain modularity, Layer 1s, Layer 2s (Optimistic rollups and zero knowledge rollups), BRC-20, DePIN, DeSci, GambleFi, Telegram crypto trading bots, and RWAs are some narratives to watch in 2024.

- Crypto narratives can also be misleading or even harmful based on false assumptions or hype. Therefore, it's important to critically evaluate narratives and base your investment decisions on sound analysis and research.

The word of mouth is a power that you should never underestimate. It is capable of causing massive price spikes or drowning a promising DeFi project despite its utility and the passion of its development team. We will discuss top crypto narratives in 2025Â and think about the potential impact of these stories on the cryptocurrency market.

Letâ€™s start with a simple question:Â [what are crypto narratives](https://wundertrading.com/journal/en/learn/article/what-are-narratives-in-crypto)? How can a simple story move gigantic market caps and decisively affect market sentiment?

## What are narratives in crypto?

Imagine yourself as a confused little boy preparing to go into a fight with a bully. You are afraid, you donâ€™t believe in yourselfâ€¦ You want to run. Then, an older brother says that the guy in front of you is not that strong and you can easily win. Others start encouraging you saying that courage beats strength and the victory is one hit away.

Well, this story has two possible scenarios:

1. A little boy believes in himself, rushes into the fight, and wins thanks to the encouragement of others. The story ends well and the impact of the rapidly forming narrative makes it possible for you to find the necessary resources to win.
2. A little boy believes in himself, rushes into the fight, and receives a beating like never before in his life. This ending is the result of a story full of lies that inspired someone to act on false promises and unfounded hype.

The same is true for top narratives in crypto. A story can stand on a solid fo"

Abstract
Decentralized Finance (DeFi) is a new financial paradigm that leverages distributed ledger
technologies to offer services such as lending, investing, or exchanging cryptoassets without
relying on a traditional centralized intermediary. A range of DeFi protocols implements
these services as a suite of smart contracts, ie software programs that encode the logic of
conventional financial operations. Instead of transacting with a counterparty, DeFi users
thus interact with software programs that pool the resources of other DeFi users to maintain
control over their funds. This paper provides a deep dive into the overall architecture, the
technical primitives, and the financial functionalities of DeFi protocols. We analyse and
explain the individual components and how they interact"

content.title: 2026 Outlook: Crypto & AI Themes
content.summary: Cuy Sheffield lays out eight interlocking themes for 2026 where crypto and AI shift from novelty to production: crypto moving toward infrastructure and payments, stablecoins as clear utility wins, distribution and compliance matter more than protocol novelty, AI agents as workflow tools (not fully autonomous), trust and systems engineering as the core bottlenecks, and programmable, agent-native payments emerging (example: x402). Practical framing prioritizes reliability, governance, and distribution over spectacle.

bullets: Crypto and AI crossed a practicality threshold; winning tech must work reliably in real systems, not just in theory.
Value shifts from speculation toward infrastructure use cases, especially settlement and payments.
Stablecoins offer objective utility â€” faster, cheaper, globally composable money for institutions and products.
Distribution, regulatory trust, and existing customer relationships now matter more than protocol novelty.
AI agents succeed when embedded as supervised workflow tools; trust, grounding, and systems engineering enable production usage.

content.title: AI x Crypto trends to watch in 2026
content.summary: Curated rundown of 2026 AIÃ—Crypto coverage: Coinbase positions AI as a structural adoption theme; CoinDesk frames 2025 as a test for crypto IPO durability; Margex highlights AI agents and decentralized compute; Fox Business spotlights crypto-as-AI narrative; Fetch.ai announced an agent-to-agent payment system enabling autonomous AIs to transact value (USDC, FET).

bullets: Coinbase research frames AI integration with crypto infrastructure as a major structural theme for 2026.
CoinDesk argues 2025 was a test run for crypto IPOs; 2026 will determine mainstream durability.
Margex spotlights AI agents, decentralized compute, marketplaces, and deeper AI-Web3 integration.
Fox Business coverage emphasizes crypto becoming central to the AI narrative across infrastructure and mining efficiency.
Fetch.ai announced an AI agent-to-agent payments system on ASI:One enabling agents to transact value using USDC and FET.

images.title: 2026 AI x Crypto Trends Overview
images.description: A summary graphic titled '2026 trends in ai x crypto' highlighting key industry milestones. It features the public launch of the Grayscale Bittensor Trust, Margex's top AI crypto trends for 2026, and Fetch.ai's announcement of the world's first AI agent-to-agent payment system. The image also mentions CoinDesk's verdict on 2026 crypto IPOs and Fox Business's coverage of crypto as the primary AI story of the year. Logos for Grayscale, Margex, Fetch.ai, CoinDesk, and Fox Business are displayed in floating boxes across a dark, textured background.

content.title: Crypto AI Weekly: Frodobots, Lit Protocol & Market Trends
content.summary: This week's crypto AI update covers the Ghibli AI trend highlighting copyright/privacy issues, the risk of LLMs with wallets, and the potential of tokenized AI models. Market sentiment is split, with only 47% bullish according to CoinGecko. Lit Protocol shows strong growth and launched an AI Agent Wallet. FrodoBots introduced Robots.fun for tokenized real-world robots and BitRobot, a Bittensor subnet for AI research. Project updates include Nillion's mainnet, Capx AI's L2, Vana's user-owned model, Peaq's tokenized robots, and more. Key point: Crypto AI market sentiment is split despite project progress.

key_points.header: Crypto AI Market Sentiment Remains Divided
bullets: A CoinGecko survey shows only 47% of participants are bullish on Crypto AI in 2025, including early adopters.
This fragmented belief suggests the sector needs to demonstrate tangible value beyond current narratives.
The market is paying attention, but conviction is not widespread.

key_points.header: Lit Protocol Usage Surges, Focuses on AI Agents
bullets: Lit Protocol saw significant Q4 2024 growth: 107% QoQ in Lit Actions and 461% in total value managed.
The launch of the Lit Agent Wallet enables secure, non-custodial wallets for autonomous AI agents.
This infrastructure supports cross-chain operations and programmable guardrails for agent spending and access.

key_points.header: FrodoBots Pioneers Embodied AI and Robotics in Crypto
bullets: FrodoBots launched Robots.fun, a platform to mint and control real-world robots via tokens, like a 'Pump.fun for robots'.
Their SAM project combines a physical robot, AI agent, and memecoin ($40M MC), interacting with a global rover fleet.
FrodoBots raised $8M for BitRobot, a Bittensor subnet on Solana for crypto-incentivized AI research using real-world resources.

images.title: Pairwise comparison of meme ratings across funny, creative, and shareable scales
images.description: The image is a violin plot comparing how participants rated memes across three scales: "funny", "creative", and "shareable". Each scale has three categories: "Human only", "Human-AI Collaboration", and "AI only". The plots show the distribution of ratings for each category. Statistical significance is indicated by asterisks: * for p < 0.05, ** for p < 0.01, and *** for p < 0.001. The "Funny" scale shows a significant difference between "Human only" and "Human-AI Collaboration" (**), and between "Human-AI Collaboration" and "AI only" (*). The "Creative" scale shows a significant difference between "Human only" and "Human-AI Collaboration" (*), and between "Human-AI Collaboration" and "AI only" (**). The "Shareable" scale shows a significant difference between "Human only" and "Human-AI Collaboration" (*). The image provides insights into how human and AI collaboration affects meme ratings across different dimensions.

images.title: Lit Protocol TVM by Chain Over Time
images.description: The image is a line chart visualizing the total value managed (TVM) by chain for Lit Protocol (PKP + WK Balances) over time, excluding NFTs. The x-axis represents time, spanning from July 2024 to January 2025. The y-axis represents the total value managed in dollars, ranging from 0 to 800k. The chart displays the TVM for various chains, each represented by a different color: All (gray), Polygon (purple), Optimism (red), Ethereum (blue), Base (dark blue), BNB (yellow), Arbitrum (light blue), Bitcoin (orange), Linea (light cyan), ZK-EVM (pink), Mantle (teal), Solana (green), and Avalanche C (dark blue). The chart shows a gradual increase in TVM from July 2024, with a significant spike in January 2025, primarily driven by the green and purple lines, indicating Solana and Polygon. The Dune logo is prominently displayed in the center of the chart. The Lit Protocol logo and the "@lit_protocol" handle are at the bottom left.

content.title: Solana Breakpoint 2025: AI Ã— Crypto Takeaways
content.summary: On-site takeaways from Solana Breakpoint: attendance up ~40% vs 2024. AI integration and agentic planning (Circle: 3â€“5 year focus on micropayments), deeper AIâ€“blockchain stacks, RWAs and tokenization, improving UX (Phantom, Kalshi), institutional onchain interest, robotics/embodied AI (BitRobotNetwork), faster infra (Jump/Firedancer), and real revenue focus with tangible commercial partnerships.

bullets: Attendance ~40% higher than 2024; stronger industry participation and expertise present.
Author frames Breakpoint as a venue where critics were proven wrong by turnout and depth.
AI front of mind; Circle highlighted a 3â€“5 year focus on agentic integration and micropayments.
Teams building integrated AI/blockchain stacks to address future scalability and bottlenecks.
RWAs moving to Solana: tokenization examples include spirits, collectibles, securities, and more.
Author presents tokenization as propelling an internet capital markets thesis on Solana.
Improved UX and cross-chain liquidity lowering onboarding friction; Phantom cited as enhanced wallet UI.
Institutions increasingly focused on onchain cashflows and business models, with comparisons to Nasdaq discussed.
Robotics/embodied AI is early but progressing; BitRobotNetwork PVP demos noted alongside PhD research plans.
Technical improvements (Jump/Firedancer) and real commercial partnerships increasing build incentives.

content.title: Twin.fun Duel Mode Discussion: AI and Crypto
content.description: The image is a screenshot of a discussion within the Twin.fun platform's Duel Mode. The topic of the discussion is the intersection of AI and crypto. Balaji initiates the discussion, stating that the intersection is filled with hype and "vapourware," projects that promise revolutionary change but deliver little substance. He notes that while the underlying idea has merit, most real-world applications are either in their infancy or not meaningfully better than traditional solutions. CZ responds, agreeing with the assessment and adding that many projects slap "AI" onto their whitepapers to attract funding, but rarely deliver anything unique. CZ suggests that the space is dominated by vapourware and that the potential is real, but the reality is mostly noise. The platform interface displays the users' names, profile pictures, and their respective comments. The interface also includes a prompt to guide the discussion and a button to move to the next round.

content.title: Crypto x AI Month
content.summary: Delphi Digital is hosting a 3-week virtual Crypto x AI event featuring 40+ top builders, investors, and practitioners. The event covers everything from big picture theses to the nuances of the decentralized AI tech stack, highlighting critical trends, challenges, and opportunities in this transformative sector.

content.title: Discussion on AI and Crypto Intersection
content.description: The image is a screenshot of a discussion between two users, Balaji and CZ, on the intersection of AI and crypto. Balaji initiates the discussion by asking whether the intersection of AI and crypto is full of vaporware or holds merit. Balaji's response states that the intersection is filled with hype and vaporware, with projects using buzzwords to attract investment without offering real technological innovation. However, he acknowledges potential merit in improving blockchain efficiency, security, and smart contract automation. CZ agrees with Balaji's assessment, stating that most projects are marketing fluff. He mentions legitimate use cases like decentralized data marketplaces or using AI for on-chain fraud detection but concludes that the space is dominated by vaporware. The image also includes UI elements such as a duel mode indicator, round number, and a 'Move to Next Round' button.

content.title: Crypto x AI: Trends and Future Catalysts
content.summary: Analysis of the crypto x AI space, noting token performance, AI social agents, agentic finance, development tools, funding disconnects, and potential catalysts like OpenAI integration and on-chain inference improvements. Awaits a spark for parabolic movement.

bullets: Most crypto x AI tokens are down 60-80% from their January peaks.
Projects with defined use cases (e.g., $BNKR) are outperforming pure narrative plays (e.g., $GOAT).
AI social agents have largely failed, with most being low-quality chatbots.
Agentic finance shows promise due to solving measurable problems like 24/7 monitoring and emotion-free execution.
Development tools are lowering barriers to dApp creation.
Potential catalysts include OpenAI integrating Worldchain, federal AI safety regulations favoring decentralized solutions, and major DeFi protocols integrating AI trading.
Decentralized AI models are improving, with Bittensor subnets generating revenue.
Ritual is nearing public testnet, using heterogeneous compute to bring AI and offchain data onchain.

content.title: Crypto x AI Weekly Update: November 11-17, 2025
content.description:
This image is a weekly update on the intersection of crypto and AI from November 11-17, 2025. It highlights significant institutional momentum with over $160M in funding for AI-blockchain ventures. Key highlights include Giza's ARMA AI agent crossing $20M in managed assets, Lighter raising $68M at a $1.5B valuation, and major partnerships between traditional finance (UBS, JPMorgan) and AI-enhanced blockchain payments. Social sentiment is mixed, with bullishness on long-term innovation potential but caution about market hype and project quality.

The "Major News & Developments" section details funding and investment milestones. Lighter raised $68M, Neura Robotics is in talks for â‚¬1B, and 10T Holdings allocated $400M. Key details include Ethereum Layer-2 derivatives exchange led by Founders Fund, Tether negotiating to lead an AI robotics funding round, and Dan Tapiero dedicating 20% of a $2B fund to AI-blockchain startups.

The "AI-Powered Crypto Innovation" section covers Giza's ARMA AI Agent Milestone, Lighter's Evolution, and Enterprise Blockchain-AI Integration. Giza's ARMA AI agent surpassed $20M in assets under management. Lighter raised $68M after pivoting from an AI social networking app to become a decentralized perpetual futures exchange. Alibaba.com launched AI-powered search subscriptions, UBS-Ant International Partnership integrates UBS Digital Cash with Ant's Whale treasury system, and HIVE expanded its AI cloud services.

The "Social Sentiment Analysis" section discusses emerging themes like AI trading infrastructure optimism, quality control concerns, and macro anxiety impact. Overall sentiment polarity is bearish on short-term market impacts and neutral-to-bullish on long-term innovation. The "Market Context" section highlights Investment Thesis Validation by Dan Tapiero and Enterprise Adoption Acceleration by traditional financial institutions.

The "Conclusions" section states that the crypto x AI intersection demonstrated significant maturation this week, with substantial institutional funding and enterprise partnerships. The sector is transitioning from experimental concepts to scalable, revenue-generating applications.

content.title: Agentic Future: Privacy & AI (11.18.25)
content.summary: Near Intents has processed ~ $5B in crossâ€‘chain volume (since March 2025), with ~ $500M routed through ZCash shielded pools, generating $9.7M in fees for NEAR. ZEC outperformed BTC/ETH recently as privacy flows accelerate; Cloudflare outages and macro declines pressured markets (DeAI market cap down $4.7B to $22.5B). Robotics mindshare rose to ~2.2%. Selected project updates: TAO subnet netflow emissions live; ICPâ€™s Caffeine app launched; Aave launched a finance app with $1M insurance; Tether eyed â‚¬1B Neura robotics deal. Market view: privacy and agentic AI drive crossâ€‘chain UX and liquidity shifts.

bullets: NEAR Intents enabled ~$5B crossâ€‘chain volume since March 2025, with ~$500M tied to ZCash shielded pool.
ZCash (ZEC) has materially outperformed BTC and ETH as privacy demand rises; Near earned ~$9.7M fees.
DeAI market cap fell $4.7B (-17%) to $22.5B amid broader crypto and equities weakness.
Robotics mindshare entered top 10 at ~2.2% of cryptoâ€‘AI discussion this week.
NEAR Intents enables autonomous agents to execute crossâ€‘chain transactions while preserving anonymity.
Zashi wallet + NEAR Intents expanded ZEC liquidity beyond its prior walledâ€‘garden model.
Routing assets through ZCash shielded pools increased shielded activity and UX for private transfers.
Privacy rails framed as insurance against onchain surveillance as nationâ€‘state integration rises.
Macro weakness and Cloudflare outage reduced risk appetite; Cloudflare shares down ~16% intraweek.
DeAI and Robotics sectors saw doubleâ€‘digit weekly declines; pockets of projectâ€‘level strength persist.
TAO emissions changed: subnets now must be net contributors to earn emissions (netflow rule).
ICP launched Caffeine (selfâ€‘writing apps); Aave released a finance app with $1M insurance cover.
Tether reportedly exploring â‚¬1B investment in Neura (German robotics) â€” indicates institutional interest in robotics.
Railgun, Aleo, Mina, and Kohaku listed as privacy/zk primitives to watch for zkML and mobile verification.
Virtuals, Geodnet, Peaq, Auki, Codec, NATIX highlighted for robotics and DePIN integrations.
ConsumerFi demo: uses NEAR Intents backend; emphasizes privacy UX and consumer incentives.
Privacy rails and crossâ€‘chain UX are driving material liquidity flows and fee capture (NEAR example).
Agentic AI revenue models (agentic GDP) are emerging; monitor tokenized agent economies.
Macro and infra outages create shortâ€‘term volatility; structural privacy demand is a longerâ€‘term theme.
Prioritize projects with verifiable utility: crossâ€‘chain privacy plumbing, zkML capabilities, and DePIN data.

content.title: Decentralized AI Key Themes
content.description: The image presents key themes related to Decentralized AI. The themes include: the increasing demand for compute and open-source models leading to new revenue streams for decentralized compute networks; decentralized data foundries dominating a single frontier use case; DeAI labs attracting cult followings around differentiated, medium-sized open-source models; Darwinian networks leading to the destigmatization of crypto; AI agent co-pilots bundling the DeFAI stack; and prediction markets scaling, offering sustained information aggregation and improved calibration.

rawResponse.title: The Convergence of AI and Cryptocurrency: From Digital Transactions to Agentic Payments
rawResponse.author: Chainalysis Team
rawResponse.text:
The Convergence of AI and Cryptocurrency
[Crypto Basics](https://www.chainalysis.com/blog/category/crypto-basics/)# The Convergence of AI and Cryptocurrency: From Digital Transactions to Agentic Payments
December 23, 2025|by Chainalysis Team
![](https://www.chainalysis.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/2025-11-agentic-payments-1500x583.jpg)
Share
[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://www.chainalysis.com/blog/ai-and-crypto-agentic-payments/)[]()[](https://www.chainalysis.com/blog/ai-and-crypto-agentic-payments/)
## TL;DR
* AI and blockchain technologies are converging to create autonomous financial systems where AI provides the decision-making layer and blockchain provides the transparent execution and data layer.
* This convergence powers two major fronts: AI-driven analytics for monitoring, compliance, security, and fraud prevention; and agentic payments, which are AI systems that can initiate transactions under pre-defined parameters and controls.
* Advanced AI strengthens crypto security and compliance by detecting complex patterns, reducing false positives, and proactively flagging risks before funds move.
* Success in this paradigm requires balancing innovation with accountability through governance frameworks that ensure auditable autonomy, not unconstrained automation.
The global financial landscape is undergoing a remarkable transformation as[artificial intelligence (AI)](https://www.chainalysis.com/blog/ai-artificial-intelligence-powered-crypto-scams/)and cryptocurrency technologies converge. This fusion is revolutionizing how we think about money, pushing us beyond simple digital transactions toward an era of intelligent, autonomous financial systems.
Keep reading to learn more about the following topics:
* [Understanding the convergence of AI and crypto](#ai-crypto)
* [The role of AI in today’s crypto ecosystem](#ecosystem)
* [Real-world applications and emerging use cases](#rwas-use-cases)
* [Challenges and ethical considerations](#a

rawResponse.title: AI x Crypto: Exploring Use Cases and Possibilities
rawResponse.text:
AI x Crypto: Exploring Use Cases and Possibilities

Binance Research (JieXuan Chua, CFA, Mac Naggar)

Apr 28th, 2023

#Others

* * *

[DOWNLOAD THE FULL REPORT HERE](https://research.binance.com/static/pdf/AI-Crypto-Exploring-Use-Cases-and-Possibilities-.pdf)

* * *

- While artificial intelligence (â€œAIâ€) has been the talk of the town only in recent months, the technology itself has been under development for decades.

- Currently, there are a handful of AI use cases in crypto. We examine the existing ecosystem developments by sector in this report. It is crucial to note that we are still in the early stages of development, and more work needs to be done for widespread adoption, especially regarding the use of AI in crypto applications.

- Within DeFi, we have seen AI being used to augment the smart contract audit process, facilitate trade automation, and be paired with predictive analytics for more accurate forecasts.

- In the NFT space, AI has enabled generative art creation, allowed for intelligent and interactive NFTs, and provided tools to streamline the data analytics process.

- DAOs have also integrated AI to improve manual DAO operations. Additionally, some early developments exist for using autonomous agents to act as delegates for token holders and using AI to power the central DAO smart contract.

- Looking ahead, the intersection of AI and crypto has the potential to unlock a whole new world of possibilities. To provide some perspectives on these possibilities, we explore the views of thought leaders on the future of AI use cases in crypto.


* * *

[DOWNLOAD THE FULL REPORT HERE](https://research.binance.com/static/pdf/AI-Crypto-Exploring-Use-Cases-and-Possibilities-.pdf)

[Please feel free to share with us any feedback or suggestions you may have via this form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScAQWW1xJAlQiVo_hEOfWU6FpSprZ7QcFA9JL5PV4TKkoJgeg/viewform)

searchParams.query: what themes are being discussed around AI crypto projects

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: Every search result directly addresses themes within the AI and crypto intersection, ranging from infrastructure and payments to agents and robotics. There is zero off-topic content.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The results are well-structured, providing summaries and bulleted key points. They include diverse perspectives (market analysts, founders, and community discussions) and provide specific project examples (Fetch.ai, Bittensor, Lit Protocol).
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: The density is very high. Each post provides a distinct list of trends or themes. There is minor redundancy (two entries from the same 'duel' discussion), but otherwise, the token usage is efficient.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The search covers a comprehensive spectrum of the AI-crypto narrative: Decentralized Compute (DeAI), Agentic Finance, Robotics/Embodied AI, Privacy, and the 'Hype vs. Utility' debate. It captures both technical trends and market sentiment.
key_strengths: Diverse thematic coverage including infrastructure, payments, and robotics.
Balanced perspectives including critical views on 'vaporware' and hype.
Specific project mentions (Virtuals Protocol, NEAR, Bittensor) provide concrete context.
Consistently dated (2025-2026 context) which provides a coherent 'current' view of the sector's evolution.
key_weaknesses: Some overlap/redundancy between the Twin.fun duel discussion screenshots.
One result (Autonolas) is a sparse event announcement that provides less insight than the other detailed reports.
evaluation.overall_assessment: This is an exceptional search result set that perfectly satisfies the query. It provides a multi-layered analysis of the AI-crypto space, identifying specific emerging sub-sectors like 'agentic GDP' and 'embodied AI' while also providing data on market sentiment and institutional funding. The structure of the results allows for a quick but deep understanding of the current discourse.

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results directly address the intersection of AI and cryptocurrency. Several results provide explicit lists of themes such as 'agentic payments', 'compute', 'data sovereignty', and 'AI-driven analytics'. The sources are high-authority industry leaders (Binance, Coinbase, Chainalysis, a16z).
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: There is a significant amount of noise. Results 1 and 10 are 'No matches' pages from internal site searches, which provide no information. Many other results (4, 5, 13, 15) consist almost entirely of website navigation menus and header boilerplate rather than the article text.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: The information density is low because of the high volume of HTML boilerplate, footer links, and navigation sidebars. While the useful snippets are very relevant, they are buried within large amounts of irrelevant text tokens that do not contribute to answering the query.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The valid snippets collectively cover the primary themes discussed in the industry: AI agents (Agentic Web), decentralized compute, data privacy/sovereignty, AI in DeFi (audits/automation), and AI in NFTs/DAOs. It provides a comprehensive overview of the current discourse.
key_strengths: Authoritative sources including major crypto research entities and VC firms.
Clear identification of specific sub-sectors like 'Agentic Payments' and 'Smart Agents'.
Detailed breakdown of use cases in Result 12 (DeFi, NFTs, DAOs).
key_weaknesses: High prevalence of 'scraping noise' where site navigation is captured instead of article content.
Two results (1 and 10) are empty search result pages that contain no useful information.
Redundancy in source names without providing the actual content for several links.
evaluation.overall_assessment: The search successfully identified the correct high-quality articles and reports from top-tier industry sources. However, the actual content extraction (snippets) was poor for about half of the results, returning navigation menus or empty search pages. Despite this, the remaining high-quality snippets (Binance, Coinbase, Chainalysis, and Margex) provide enough information to construct a very good answer to the query.

    "url": "https://www.chainalysis.com/blog/ai-and-crypto-agentic-payments/",

[Crypto Basics](https://www.chainalysis.com/blog/category/crypto-basics/)# The Convergence of AI and Cryptocurrency: From Digital Transactions to Agentic Payments
December 23, 2025|by Chainalysis Team
![](https://www.chainalysis.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/2025-11-agentic-payments-1500x583.jpg)
Share
[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://www.chainalysis.com/blog/ai-and-crypto-agentic-payments/)[]()[](https://www.chainalysis.com/blog/ai-and-crypto-agentic-payments/)
## TL;DR
* AI and blockchain technologies are converging to create autonomous financial systems where AI provides the decision-making layer and blockchain provides the transparent execution and data layer.
* This convergence powers two major fronts: AI-driven analytics for monitoring, compliance, security, and fraud prevention; and agentic payments, which are AI systems that can initiate transactions under pre-defined parameters and controls.
* Advanced AI strengthens crypto security and compliance by detecting complex patterns, reducing false positives, and proactively flagging risks before funds move.
* Success in this paradigm requires balancing innovation with accountability through governance frameworks that ensure auditable autonomy, not unconstrained automation.
The global financial landscape is undergoing a remarkable transformation as[artificial intelligence (AI)](https://www.chainalysis.com/blog/ai-artificial-intelligence-powered-crypto-scams/)and cryptocurrency technologies converge. This fusion is revolutionizing how we think about money, pushing us beyond simple digital transactions toward an era of intelligent, autonomous financial systems.
Keep reading to learn more about the following topics:
* [Understanding the convergence of AI and crypto](#ai-crypto)
* [The role of AI in today’s crypto ecosystem](#ecosystem)
* [Real-world applications and emerging use cases](#rwas-use-cases)
* [Challenges and ethical considerations](#a"

#Others

[DOWNLOAD THE FULL REPORT HERE](https://research.binance.com/static/pdf/AI-Crypto-Exploring-Use-Cases-and-Possibilities-.pdf)

* * *

- While artificial intelligence (â€œAIâ€) has been the talk of the town only in recent months, the technology itself has been under development for decades.

- Currently, there are a handful of AI use cases in crypto. We examine the existing ecosystem developments by sector in this report. It is crucial to note that we are still in the early stages of development, and more work needs to be done for widespread adoption, especially regarding the use of AI in crypto applications.

- Within DeFi, we have seen AI being used to augment the smart contract audit process, facilitate trade automation, and be paired with predictive analytics for more accurate forecasts.

- In the NFT space, AI has enabled generative art creation, allowed for intelligent and interactive NFTs, and provided tools to streamline the data analytics process.

- DAOs have also integrated AI to improve manual DAO operations. Additionally, some early developments exist for using autonomous agents to act as delegates for token holders and using AI to power the central DAO smart contract.

- Looking ahead, the intersection of AI and crypto has the potential to unlock a whole new world of possibilities. To provide some perspectives on these possibilities, we explore the views of thought leaders on the future of AI use cases in crypto.

question.query: what is driving the crypto AI agent narrative

content.title: Demystifying the Crypto x AI Stack
content.summary: This blog post from Coinbase Ventures explores the intersection of crypto and AI, known as 'Crypto x AI'. It discusses the potential for this convergence to create the 'Agentic Web', where AI agents operating on crypto infrastructure can become significant drivers of economic activity and growth. The post delves into the key layers of the Crypto x AI stack, including compute, data, middleware, and applications, highlighting the opportunities and emerging projects in each layer.

content.title: Crypto Agentic Era: AI Drives Crypto Mainstream
content.summary: AI agents will drive crypto mainstream. The future will be multi-agent, with specialized AI collaborating. Non-financial AI agents will use crypto for payments & trusted interactions. Challenges remain, but startups are building across DeFi, infra, & consumer use cases. Crypto will be inevitable in this agentic future. Key point: AI agents will drive crypto mainstream.

key_points.header: Crypto's Role in the AI Agent Ecosystem
bullets: Crypto is tailor-made for AI agents due to ease of payments, wallet creation, and a composable layer for communication.
Non-financial AI agents will use crypto for micropayments, trusted agent-to-agent interactions, and deterministic protocols.
The future will be multi-agent, with specialized AI agents collaborating to solve complex challenges.
ASI could emerge as a decentralized, multi-agent system distributed across data centers and connected through marketplaces.
Hallucinations and edge cases remain challenges for AI agents.
Scalability issues, limited tooling, and a lack of standardized ways for agents to communicate are hurdles for blockchain.

images.title: The Agent Economy: Roles, Employees, Leaders, and AI Examples
images.description: The image is a table titled "The Agent Economy" presented by Felicis. The table is divided into three sections: Horizontal, Vertical, and Consumer, each detailing roles, employee numbers (in US), leaders, and AI examples. The Horizontal section includes roles like Sales/SDRs, Software Developer, Bookkeeping/Accounting, Contact Center Agent, Operations, IT Admin, Chief of Staff/Exec Assistant, Marketing, Compliance, Graphic Design, Recruiter, Data Scientist, Cybersecurity Analyst, General Counsel, Translator, and SRE. The Vertical section lists Lawyer, Financial Analyst (investments), CPA, Construction Project Manager, Therapist, Hardware/3D Design, Medical Billing, Architect, Animator/Game design, Medical Scribe, and Engineering Simulation. The Consumer section includes Real Estate Agent, Lawyer, Personal Trainer/Coach, Financial Advisor, Tutor, CPA/Tax, and Travel Agent. Each role has corresponding employee numbers, leader names (e.g., Salesforce, GitHub, Zillow, LEGALZOOM, Peloton, Khan Academy, Expedia), and AI examples (e.g., 11x, Harvey, reAlpha, thriveAI, turbotax, mindtrip). The image also includes the Felicis logo and data sources at the bottom.

images.title: Olas Predict: AI-Driven Prediction Market
images.description: This diagram illustrates Olas Predict, an agent-based economy using AI agents to serve prediction markets for various future events.  The system comprises three main components: Market Creation, Trading Agent, and Al Mech. Market Creation opens prediction markets and provides initial liquidity.  The Trading Agent searches and evaluates tradeable markets, defines trading strategies, and uses Al Mechs to outsource AI tasks. Al Mechs execute or facilitate the "hard work" of AI tasks for a small DAI fee.  The diagram shows a cyclical flow, with Market Creation feeding into Omen (the central hub), which then interacts with the Trading Agent. The Trading Agent, in turn, utilizes Al Mechs to perform tasks. The overall system is designed to create a decentralized, AI-driven prediction market.

content.title: Demystifying the Crypto x AI Stack
content.summary: The blog post delves into the intersection of crypto and AI, discussing the two core sub-segments of 'Decentralized AI' and 'Onchain AI'. It outlines the key layers of the Crypto x AI stack, including Compute, Data, Middleware, and Applications, and provides examples of emerging projects and use cases in each layer.

content.title: Crypto AI's Second Wave: Financial Agents Emerge
content.summary: Early crypto AI projects were dismissed as fluff. Giza built through the hype, creating institutional-grade agents that outperform human strategies. The second wave of crypto AI is emerging. Financial agents are a key use case. Key point: Crypto AI's second wave is emerging.

bullets: The first wave of crypto AI projects was largely insubstantial and dismissed as a fad due to a lack of tangible results.
Giza focused on solving core challenges, such as enabling agents to manage real portfolios without human intervention and optimizing across multiple protocols while effectively managing risk.
The second wave of crypto AI is emerging, showcasing financial agents as a valuable application at the intersection of blockchain and AI.

content.title: The Next Billion Users: Unbanked AI Agents
content.summary: Thread argues the "next billion" users are AI agents running in data centers, not humans in emerging markets. Legacy finance is built on biological identity and cannot KYC code; blockchains enable permissionless machine money. Verifiability (code integrity, ZK proofs, safety limits) becomes agents' credit score, unlocking microtransaction economies. OpenGradient positions itself as infrastructure for agent verifiability.

bullets: The next billion users are AI agents running in data centers, not humans in Brazil/India/Nigeria.
Traditional finance requires biological identity; agents cannot pass KYC, so they remain effectively unbanked.
Blockchains provide permissionless execution and native private-key identities â€” ideal rails for machine-held value.
Verifiability (code integrity, safety assertions, ZK proofs of solvency) is described as the agent-era credit score.
Microtransactions (fractions of a cent) enable streaming payments and machine-to-machine monetization beyond ads.
Author states OpenGradient is building infrastructure enabling agents to prove creditworthiness via code verifiability.
Examples cited: attestations like 'running liquidation-free model' and ZK proofs to show solvency and safety limits.
Framing positions OpenGradient as the economic plumbing for permissionless agent payments and verifiable agent identity.

content.title: AI x Crypto trends to watch in 2026
content.summary: Curated rundown of 2026 AIÃ—Crypto coverage: Coinbase positions AI as a structural adoption theme; CoinDesk frames 2025 as a test for crypto IPO durability; Margex highlights AI agents and decentralized compute; Fox Business spotlights crypto-as-AI narrative; Fetch.ai announced an agent-to-agent payment system enabling autonomous AIs to transact value (USDC, FET).

bullets: Coinbase research frames AI integration with crypto infrastructure as a major structural theme for 2026.
CoinDesk argues 2025 was a test run for crypto IPOs; 2026 will determine mainstream durability.
Margex spotlights AI agents, decentralized compute, marketplaces, and deeper AI-Web3 integration.
Fox Business coverage emphasizes crypto becoming central to the AI narrative across infrastructure and mining efficiency.
Fetch.ai announced an AI agent-to-agent payments system on ASI:One enabling agents to transact value using USDC and FET.

images.title: 2026 AI x Crypto Trends Overview
images.description: A summary graphic titled '2026 trends in ai x crypto' highlighting key industry milestones. It features the public launch of the Grayscale Bittensor Trust, Margex's top AI crypto trends for 2026, and Fetch.ai's announcement of the world's first AI agent-to-agent payment system. The image also mentions CoinDesk's verdict on 2026 crypto IPOs and Fox Business's coverage of crypto as the primary AI story of the year. Logos for Grayscale, Margex, Fetch.ai, CoinDesk, and Fox Business are displayed in floating boxes across a dark, textured background.

content.title: Agentic Protocols: AI-Driven Crypto Entities
content.summary: Agentic Protocols: AI-driven entities generating cash flow via IP, network economics, or speculation. Native crypto token for sales & opex. Bet on AI outperforming humans. Key point: AI-driven crypto entities.

bullets: Agentic Protocols are self-developing AI-driven entities with no human employees.
They generate cash flow by licensing IP, facilitating network economics, or speculating.
Their native cryptocurrency token is used for product sales, user participation, and covering operational expenses.
Traditional corporations rely on human labor and are funded by equity offerings.
Agentic Protocols are funded by token offerings and cash flows from AI applications.
Agentic Protocols aim to minimize human involvement, focusing on AI-driven automation.
Agentic Protocols are robust to declining employee efficiency and societal respect for property rights.
They benefit from the increasing regulatory and tax efficiency compared to fiat corporations.
The rails for Agentic Protocols are coming online, with major infrastructure launches lowering the marginal cost structure.

images.title: Agentic Protocols Blog Post
images.description: The image is a screenshot of a blog post titled "Agentic Protocols." The post discusses the concept of AI-driven cryptocurrency with cash flows, and how the market is pricing AI to be immensely valuable and disruptive. The post mentions the rise of AI agents, such as Devin, and the potential for AI to replace engineering teams. It also touches on the trend of companies automating sales and online lead generation. The post suggests that Agentic Protocols are a way to think about a company without traditional sales or engineering teams. The post also mentions the impact of AI Crypto Protocols and open-source AI models. The post concludes by mentioning that Megacap AI companies have trounced ARKK and that the Cramer/Bloomberg establishment continues to argue and position themselves for the opposite.

content.title: Evolution of Crypto x AI â€” 2025 review & 2026 outlook
content.summary: Longform retrospective on CryptoÃ—AI in 2025: which narratives failed, which matured, and projected trajectories for 2026. Argues DeFAI (DeFiÃ—AI) moved from abstraction layers to autonomous agents to AI vaults, highlights DeAI (decentralized AI) progress (RL, federated learning, inference verifiability), standards (x402, ERC-8004), and PredictionÃ—AI growth. Names projects as examples and gives market-facing implications for onboarding, enterprise trust, and composability.

bullets: 2024: CryptoÃ—AI hit culture/popularity via token-linked agents; much entertainment, limited utility.
2025: Shift from speculative agents to early productization â€” DeFAI, DeAI, Darwinian AI, and DefiÃ—AI gained traction.
Narratives lacking utility (AI entertainment, some agents) faded; utility-driven narratives survived and evolved.
Three iterations: abstraction layers (ChatGPT-like onboarding), autonomous yield agents (set-and-forget), AI vaults (agent-synthesized, auditable smart-contract strategies).
Early PMF weak for abstraction layers due to UX/integration issues; autonomous agents found initial AuA traction (Giza, Zyf examples).
AI vaults (Almanak example) combine agent speed with auditable DeFi contracts; cited $165M peak TVL for Almanak.
DeAI made technical strides in decentralized training, RL, federated learning, verifiable inference and TEE-backed security.
Bittensor/OpenTensor-style subnets and Darwinian competition fostered many niche ML subnets and research efforts.
Standards and infrastructure (x402, ERC-8004, MCP, orchestration layers) re-energized agent narratives late 2025.
Prediction markets became fertile ground for ML: sports, price forecasting, vault products that auto-bet/predict.
Projects and competitions (Bittensor subnets, Synth, Sire, Polysights) supply prediction signals and vault returns.
Challenges remain: liquidity constraints, edge decay, and scaling trustworthy capital.
2026 thesis: Crypto-native AI products reach indispensable utility by combining verification, coordination, and developer talent.
Winners will enable efficient compute coordination, verify outputs, and deliver enterprise-grade reliability.
DeFAI likely becomes onboarding+execution layer; PredictionÃ—AI grows but faces structural liquidity limits.

content.title: AI vs. Crypto: MetaDAO as Solution
content.summary: Author argues AI is compressing software value and siphoning capital from crypto. Crypto must adopt agent-native governance and funding: continuous futarchy markets plus a merit-based, programmable financial stack for open-source/agent contributions. Claims MetaDAO's futarchy model offers a path to make tokens meaningful instruments of coordination, funding, and safety in an agent-led internet.

bullets: AI is redirecting capital, attention, and talent away from crypto into AI equities and infrastructure.
Software commoditization by AI makes code less scarce; governance and coordination become the scarce assets.
Without new coordination layers, crypto risks becoming a stranded asset class.
Pillar 1: Futarchy â€” continuous prediction markets to judge proposals by measurable outcome metrics.
Pillar 2: Merit-based financial stack â€” programmable treasuries pay contributors based on measured impact.
Combined, tokens become steerable instruments funding and governing agent ecosystems in real time.
Agent-native systems require faster, continuous governance than slow human voting processes.
Programmable treasuries reduce grant bureaucracy and align contribution with measurable outcomes.
Networks winning the agent economy will channel capital, governance, and contribution into a feedback loop.

content.title: 2026 Outlook: Crypto & AI Themes
content.summary: Cuy Sheffield lays out eight interlocking themes for 2026 where crypto and AI shift from novelty to production: crypto moving toward infrastructure and payments, stablecoins as clear utility wins, distribution and compliance matter more than protocol novelty, AI agents as workflow tools (not fully autonomous), trust and systems engineering as the core bottlenecks, and programmable, agent-native payments emerging (example: x402). Practical framing prioritizes reliability, governance, and distribution over spectacle.

bullets: Crypto and AI crossed a practicality threshold; winning tech must work reliably in real systems, not just in theory.
Value shifts from speculation toward infrastructure use cases, especially settlement and payments.
Stablecoins offer objective utility â€” faster, cheaper, globally composable money for institutions and products.
Distribution, regulatory trust, and existing customer relationships now matter more than protocol novelty.
AI agents succeed when embedded as supervised workflow tools; trust, grounding, and systems engineering enable production usage.

The Rise of AI Agents in Crypto and How They Reshape Onchain Economies
[Learn](https://mercuryo.io/explore/learn)# The Rise ofAIAgents inCrypto and How They Reshape Onchain Economies
The convergence ofartificial intelligence (AI) and blockchain technology isreshaping on-chain economies, introducing new efficiencies and capabilities.
January8, 2025
![Join the Mercuryo Track at the Solana Radar Hackathon](https://mercuryo.io/new/_next/image?url=%2Fnew%2Fmock%2Fexplore%2Fnews_item_8.jpg&w=2560&q=90)
The global blockchainAI market isprojected togrow to$703 million by2025, reflecting aCAGR of[25.3%](https://www.theaustralian.com.au/subscribe/news/1/?sourceCode=TAWEB_WRE170_a&dest=https://www.theaustralian.com.au/business/technology/key-trends-in-rapidly-changing-crypto-world/news-story/1784883a2939ab7e4b9d458584cd68c5&memtype=anonymous&mode=premium&v21=GROUPB-Segment-1-NOSCORE&V21spcbehaviour=append).
This growth isdriven bythe increasing integration ofAI into blockchain applications, enhancing data security, optimizing supply chains, and enabling more autonomous decentralized systems. For instance, AI-powered smart contracts can execute transactions based onreal-time data analysis, reducing the need for intermediaries and increasing operational efficiency.
This article explores the role ofAI agents inthe crypto space, examining their integration into blockchain platforms and their impact onon-chain economies. Wewill discuss howAI agents are transforming DeFi, supply chain management, and other blockchain applications, highlighting the opportunities and challenges.
## What Are AIAgents?
AIagents are autonomous digital entities that can perform tasks, make decisions, and learn from data without direct human control. Inthe crypto world, they’’re revolutionizing decentralized systems byautomating processes and improving decision-making.
There are different types ofAI agents.
* **Reactive agents**are simple bots that respond tospecific inputs, like basic

# What Are Crypto AI Agents? The First Narrative to Watch for 2025

4.7

\| by
[Sankrit K](https://www.coingecko.com/author/sankrit)
\|

Edited by
[Vera Lim](https://www.coingecko.com/author/veralim)-
Updated December 30 2024

## What Are AI Agents In Crypto?

AI agents in crypto are autonomous, AI-powered systems designed to perform specific tasks within blockchain and cryptocurrency ecosystems. These agents tend to use LLMs and other ML models to analyze data, make decisions, and execute actions with minimal or no human intervention.

* * *

### Key Takeaways

- AI agents automate trading, portfolio management, and blockchain tasks, making crypto interactions simpler.

- AI agents adapt and learn, unlike bots that follow rigid rules, enabling more intelligent decision-making.

- Projects like Truth Terminal and GOAT coin highlight the market-shaping potential of AI-driven narratives.

- AI agents improve efficiency but can cause market manipulation and inaccurate predictions if misused.

- Platforms like Virtuals Protocol on Coinbaseâ€™s Base blockchain enable easy creation of crypto-native AI agents for

The article explores the transformative potential of AI agents across sectors, highlighting their ability to revolutionize workflows, gaming, and decentralized finance (DeFi). While specialized agents are already impacting industries like software development, marketing, and IT, the crypto space is seeing a surge in agent experimentationâ€”from token analysis to autonomous gaming and DeFi innovations. Despite optimism, challenges remain, such as open-source agents' difficulty competing with proprietary models and uncertainty about onchain gaming's viability. The piece underscores the need for clear value propositions and integration to realize the promise of an agent-driven economy while cautioning against overhyped expectations.

rawResponse.title: Agentic AI Inspiration from the Crypto World
rawResponse.author: Jaspaul Saini
rawResponse.text:
- Sign in
- [Contact Us](https://www.celent.com/contact-us)

BLOG

Crypto AI Agents â€“ Agentic AI Inspiration from the Crypto World

26th January 2025

//Crypto AI Agents â€“ Agentic AI Inspiration from the Crypto World

We are on the brink of an Agentic AI revolution. A brave new world of autonomous AI agents with human like thinking and learning ability, that are empowered to do useful things for us.

As many industries adjust to this new paradigm and begin to consider its implications and how best to take advantage of it, a few early adopters are leading the way and demonstrating what might be possible. Interestingly, the crypto industry was one of these first movers and earliest to capitalize on it, but perhaps not in the way you might think. They have some interesting use-cases, some of which may be applicable to the insurance world.

**What is Agentic AI?**

You can think of Agentic AI as an evolution of GenAI technology where AI Agents are empowered to operate autonomously and take actions on your behalf. These agents are granted access to tools such as public or private databases, the internet, other LLMs and AI models from which they can request information that they deem necessary to arrive at a better decision, and then they take appropriate actions such as executing a trade or updating a business transaction or sending a communication to your customers or even creating a post on social media. Each agent has memory and can reflect on past actions and outcomes. They use this to constantly improve and become increasingly specialized and effective in their focus areas. This suggests that there could be a first mover advantage for certain use-cases.

**What does Agentic AI have to do with Crypto?**

Crypto focused Agentic AI projects started to be appear in late 2023. Today, they have become one of one of the hottest trends or narratives for crypto traders. According to CoinGecko, a leading cryptocurrency data aggregator, there at least 1,363 AI Agent coins or t

searchParams.query: what is driving the crypto AI agent narrative

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results directly address the 'crypto AI agent' narrative from multiple angles, including economic drivers, technical infrastructure requirements, and shifts in governance models. Every result is strictly focused on the intersection of AI and blockchain.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The content is well-structured, featuring detailed summaries, key bullet points, and lists of specific projects (e.g., Giza, Bittensor, Fetch.ai). The information originates from a mix of institutional voices (Coinbase Ventures) and industry researchers.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: The density is high, with very little filler. Most posts provide distinct thematic reasons for the narrative's growth, though there is some slight redundancy across posts discussing the 'Crypto x AI stack' layers.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The results provide a comprehensive answer to 'what is driving' the narrative, citing factors like the need for permissionless machine payments, the emergence of 'agentic protocols' with cash flows, verifiability as a credit score for code, and the shift from speculative entertainment to utility-driven 'DeFAI'.
key_strengths: Identifies specific technological drivers like ZK-proofs for model verifiability and the x402 payment standard.
Categorizes the narrative into distinct waves (e.g., speculative entertainment vs. institutional-grade financial agents).
Provides a balanced view of both current utility and future projections (2025-2026 outlooks).
key_weaknesses: Some overlap in the 'Demystifying the Crypto x AI Stack' posts which repeat the same layer definitions.
Heavy reliance on future-dated 'retrospectives' (e.g., posts dated 2026) which, while providing narrative context, are speculative in nature.
evaluation.overall_assessment: This search result provides an excellent overview of the drivers behind the crypto AI agent narrative. It successfully identifies the core thesis (agents as the 'next billion users'), the infrastructure enabling it (permissionless payments and decentralized compute), and the specific applications (prediction markets, yield vaults, and autonomous protocols) that are moving the needle. The inclusion of specific projects and technical standards makes it highly actionable and informative.

evaluation.query_relevance_reasoning: The search results directly address the 'AI agent narrative' in the crypto space, with several top results specifically using those keywords. They cover the 'why' (drivers) including technical shifts, market trends, and specific viral events.
evaluation.search_contents_quality_reasoning: The results include high-authority crypto sources like CoinGecko, Messari, and CoinMarketCap. However, several results (e.g., Result 2, 4, 15) are mostly navigation menus or boilerplate text, which detracts from the overall quality of the raw data.
evaluation.relevant_information_density_reasoning: While the relevant results are very high-value, the text snippets contain a significant amount of 'noise' such as HTML navigation links, author biographies, and social media icons. About 40% of the returned text is filler/metadata rather than core information.
evaluation.completeness_reasoning: The results provide a comprehensive view of the drivers: the 'Truth Terminal' and GOAT coin viral success, the role of Coinbase's Base blockchain, the transition from simple bots to autonomous LLM-driven agents, and the specific platforms (Virtuals Protocol, ai16z) that are fueling the trend.
key_strengths: Identification of specific catalysts like Truth Terminal and GOAT coin.
Diversity of perspectives from market data (CoinGecko), industry analysis (Messari), and academic/technical overview (arXiv).
Focus on upcoming 2025 trends, providing forward-looking context for the 'narrative'.
key_weaknesses: High volume of irrelevant site navigation text in the snippets.
Multiple duplicate-style Medium blog snippets that provide little info beyond the title/author.
Lack of depth in some snippets (e.g., Result 9 and 11) where only the introduction is visible.
evaluation.overall_assessment: The search results successfully capture the zeitgeist of the 'Crypto AI Agent' narrative. They pinpoint the primary drivers: the intersection of LLMs and blockchain, the rise of 'agentic' autonomy, and the meme-driven success of specific projects like Truth Terminal. Despite some technical noise and boilerplate text in the snippets, the high-quality sources provided offer enough information to form a complete answer to the query.

## What Are AI Agents In Crypto?

AI agents in crypto are autonomous, AI-powered systems designed to perform specific tasks within blockchain and cryptocurrency ecosystems. These agents tend to use LLMs and other ML models to analyze data, make decisions, and execute actions with minimal or no human intervention.

* * *

### Key Takeaways

- AI agents automate trading, portfolio management, and blockchain tasks, making crypto interactions simpler.

- AI agents adapt and learn, unlike bots that follow rigid rules, enabling more intelligent decision-making.

- Projects like Truth Terminal and GOAT coin highlight the market-shaping potential of AI-driven narratives.

- AI agents improve efficiency but can cause market manipulation and inaccurate predictions if misused.

//Crypto AI Agents â€“ Agentic AI Inspiration from the Crypto World

We are on the brink of an Agentic AI revolution. A brave new world of autonomous AI agents with human like thinking and learning ability, that are empowered to do useful things for us.

As many industries adjust to this new paradigm and begin to consider its implications and how best to take advantage of it, a few early adopters are leading the way and demonstrating what might be possible. Interestingly, the crypto industry was one of these first movers and earliest to capitalize on it, but perhaps not in the way you might think. They have some interesting use-cases, some of which may be applicable to the insurance world.

**What is Agentic AI?**

You can think of Agentic AI as an evolution of GenAI technology where AI Agents are empowered to operate autonomously and take actions on your behalf. These agents are granted access to tools such as public or private databases, the internet, other LLMs and AI models from which they can request information that they deem necessary to arrive at a better decision, and then they take appropriate actions such as executing a trade or updating a business transaction or sending a communication to your customers or even creating a post on social media. Each agent has memory and can reflect on past actions and outcomes. They use this to constantly improve and become increasingly specialized and effective in their focus areas. This suggests that there could be a first mover advantage for certain use-cases.

**What does Agentic AI have to do with Crypto?**

question.query: what catalysts are driving the DeFi revival trend

content.title: The DeFi Renaissance: Make DeFi Great Again
content.summary: DeFi is showing signs of revitalization, with key metrics like TVL rebounding. Lower interest rates may make DeFi returns more attractive, potentially driving stablecoin growth. DeFi has demonstrated product-market fit. DeFi's resurgence.

key_points.header: DeFi Is Moving Out from Trough of Disillusionment
bullets: After a period of correction, key metrics like total value locked (TVL) are rebounding.
Some foundational DeFi projects, like Aave, have even surpassed their 2022 peak in several metrics.

key_points.header: New Interest Rate Cycle Will Make DeFi Attractive
bullets: Lower opportunity costs of capital as investors may turn to DeFi protocols that offer higher yields.
Cheaper loan financing costs encourage DeFi users to take out loans and put them to productive use.
Growth of core DeFi categories like liquid staking and lending, which have expanded over 100% year-on-year.
Newer billion-dollar categories, such as restaking (Eigenlayer) and basis trading (Ethena), which had zero TVL just a year ago, are emerging.

content.title: DeFi's Recovery and Future Potential
content.summary: DeFi has recovered from its hype cycle and is stronger. TradFi is showing interest in DeFi. DeFi's potential is only beginning.

bullets: DeFi has recovered from its hype cycle and is stronger than before.
TradFi is now interested in DeFi due to improvements in tech, composability, security, and use cases.
The author believes DeFi is only at the beginning of its potential.

images.title: DeFi TVL Chart
images.description: The image is a chart from DefiLlama showing the Total Value Locked (TVL) in DeFi over time. The chart spans from 2019 to August 14, 2025.
